programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Greg Miller, CEO of the Larry H Miller Group of Companies and co-owner of National Basketball Association team the Utah Jazz, goes undercover. Since his dad died he has made many changes to the organisation, and posing as a contestant on a reality TV competition to win a dream job, he works among his own staff to see if his father's legacy still lives on.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Former undercover bosses, including the co-owner of a frozen yoghurt company and the chief executive of a sports bar and grill, want to take another look at the everyday workings of their businesses, but fear they will be recognised. They each send an employee in their place to report on how their firms are functioning.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Pickwick Pawnbrokers boss Nathan might have laid his hands on a fourth-century statue worth tens of thousands of pounds, while another customer is selling a rare grandfather clock.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Sheffield pawnbroker Dan values a handbag believed to once belong to Cheryl, and finds a pair of designer Tom Ford shoes that could be worth a small fortune.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Roberta Smithies from the Lake District in Cumbria hopes to wave goodbye to her childhood home and embrace a new life in Costa Rica. She has a budget of £200,000 and hopes Jonnie Irwin will find her a property with views that are impressive enough to tempt her to make an offer.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Each year Mary Anderson likes to avoid the UK's cold winter months by spending her time in Naples in Florida, and now wishes to secure her own property in the region. Sara Damergi helps her identify suitable premises, which include a house with its own pool and a beach apartment.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: New series. Jasmine Harman tries to help Dave and Debbie Gough from Swindon, who have been holidaying on the Costa Blanca for 30 years and now want to retire there.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Jane and Jilly from Brighton look for a holiday home in the Dordogne region of south-west France. Laura Hamilton shows them five suitable properties for their £100,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: David and Megan Penny from Gloucestershire search for a holiday home in the Axarquia area of southern Spain, where they can enjoy a laid-back lifestyle with their dog.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman comes to the aid of Sue and Mike Bloomfield from Manchester, who with Mike's retirement around the corner want to buy a holiday home on the Algarve.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps Derbyshire pair Sara and Paul find a holiday home in the Murcia region of Spain on a budget of £38,000.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer visit Hastings to help two couples look for their dream homes. However, with extravagant ideas and limited budgets on the agenda, they have their work cut out locating suitable properties. Jakki and Scott are determined to find a house before the arrival of their baby, while newlyweds Chris and Nicola want a two-bedroom family home in a great location.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 36-year-old man is rushed to St George's after being involved in a high-speed road traffic collision, with CT scans revealing a potentially life-threatening injury to his spleen. Meanwhile, a 21-year-old who dislocated his finger scoring the winning points in a basketball match believes his trip to A&E is the perfect subject for one of his vlogs.(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The midwives at Liverpool Women's Hospital face the mother of all shifts. With the maternity ward full, three couples manage to get a room, but have different experiences. Self-confessed princess Sarah and her devoted fiance Chris arrive eight weeks earlier than expected. Big kid Gary strives to grow up and become the responsible father and husband that his partner Claire demands. And Mormons Chloe and Daniel hope their new baby will bring them a step closer to the large and busy family they dream of.(n)

programme.title: The World's Weirdest Weather
programme.desc: Sunlight appears to transform water into liquid gold in California, a record-breaking heatwave wipes out thousands of bats in Australia, and weird weather makes sand dunes sing in the deserts of the Middle East. Plus, little-understood gravity waves captured on camera, how water can break apart rocks, why a lake in Canada is coming out in spots, and the unlucky tourist who visited the Grand Canyon, only to find the basin filled with thick fog.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A five-year-old Great Dane is rushed to Fitzpatrick Referrals after losing the use of its back legs due to a slipped disc, with complications leaving the dog fighting for its life. A woman and her two children bring their pet spaniel to the practice after it is hit by a car, and a 10-year-old collie with hip dysplasia visits the surgery.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Schrodinger the cat is brought in with a shattered thighbone after being hit by a car, and Noel Fitzpatrick prepares to fuse the broken pieces back together in an all-night operation. Plus, English bulldog Lois is put on a strict diet and given an exercise regimen, and an elderly springer spaniel called Flossie, who has lost control of her back legs, arrives at the clinic.(n)

programme.title: Who Wants My Council House
programme.desc: Documentary following five households looking to swap their council house. Some want to upgrade to their ideal home, others simply fancy a change of scenery and some are parents seeking to downsize now that their children have flown the nest. However, council house swaps do not involve estate agents with sharp sales patter. It is up to the tenants to show each other around their homes and do the hard sell. If the first viewing goes well, there will be an invitation for a return viewing before both sides decide whether to swap - or not.(n)

programme.title: The Restoration Man
programme.desc: Architect George Clarke meets restoration novices Mark Hinchcliffe and Laura Rushton, who have embarked upon a risky plan to convert two crumbling church buildings into family homes. The entire project hangs on them making a success of the first building, an old listed Sunday school, because they plan to use the profits from its sale to turn the second building - a cavernous Victorian church - into their own home. It soon becomes clear they are born restorers - but hidden costs threaten to compromise their standards.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay checks in to Murphy's Historic Hotel near Sacramento in northern California, where owners Brian, Kevin and Joel are often too distracted by their lively bar to look after their business. The national landmark, which has played host to an array of famous names including Mark Twain, President Ulysses S Grant and JP Morgan, has no dedicated accommodation manager, so guests sometimes struggle to receive the attention they need and end up feeling the hotel has become an afterthought beside the noisy saloon.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: At London Road pawnbrokers in Sheffield, boss Dan values some African-inspired art, while customer Sarah hopes to secure a big cash deal by selling her diamond earrings.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers

programme.title: Location, Location, Location

programme.desc: Salesman Richard Massey hosts the first party in Colchester, hoping his cheeky-chappy demeanour and signature dish Drunken Duck will be enough to see him walk away with the £1,000 prize at the end of the week-long competition.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: American army wife Adrena Austin hosts the third dinner party in Colchester. She hopes her simple menu, which revisits her Armenian heritage, will be a welcome change for her guests, but while reactions to the main course are mixed, her entertainment proves a resounding success.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away

programme.title: Blind Date
programme.desc: The dating game show concludes, as Paul O'Grady sets out to help two more singletons find romance. This time, he lends his assistance to Sophie, a flight attendant who hopes to find a cheeky chap who can love her in spite of her goofy, childlike ways. Also seeking a spark of attraction is Ted, a business development manager who is looking for a kind-hearted girlfriend who is also independent and ambitious. Plus, Paul catches up with last week's couples to find out how whether their dates were a success. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.desc: The documentary focuses on people on benefits in the West Midlands. They include single mum-of-five Emma, who needs income support to help feed her children - but cannot afford their school uniforms - and 29-year-old Antonio, whose on-off work pattern has left him in debt, prompting him to seek help from his local MP to keep a roof over his head. Former Asbo kid Danny, now 21, is trying to put his criminal past behind him, and 59-year-old Teresa, just a few weeks off retirement, has been deemed unfit to work by her doctor - but the benefits office does not agree.(n)

programme.title: Monster's Ball
programme.desc: Director Marc Forster, winner of Best Feature at Slamdance for his debut film Loungers (1996) and the "Someone to Watch" Independent Spirit Award for his indie drama Everything Put Together (2000), follows up those acclaimed projects with this intense, racially charged romance. Billy Bob Thornton stars as Georgia prison guard Hank Grotowski, a hard-drinking racist ex-cop whose father, Buck (Peter Boyle), is dying of emphysema and whose son, Sonny (Heath Ledger), works the execution detail at the prison's death row. When Sonny commits suicide, Hank is devastated and quits his job, spiraling into a deep depression until, one night, he comes to the aid of Leticia (Halle Berry), a beautiful African-American woman whose son, Tyrell (Coronji Calhoun), has been hit by a car. When Tyrell dies, Leticia and Hank find themselves to be unexpected soul mates linked together by tragic grief. It's not long before Hank discovers that Leticia is the widow of Lawrence Musgrove (Sean Combs), the man whose execution by electric chair he and his late son helped to orchestrate. Monster's Ball (2001) is based on a screenplay by actors Milo Addica and Will Rokos, who spent five years developing their script into a feature. Their title refers to the name of an English tradition requiring jailers to throw a party for a condemned man on the night before his death(n)

programme.title: Domestic Disturbance
programme.desc: John Travolta stars in this thriller as divorced husband and father Frank Morrison, a boat builder concerned about his son Danny (Matthew O'Leary), a troubled 11-year-old who has shown a tendency to lie since his parents broke up. When his ex-wife Susan (Teri Polo) announces that she's getting remarried to Rick Barnes (Vince Vaughn), a recent arrival in town and a popular, wealthy philanthropist, Frank struggles with jealousy but feels that Rick might be a stabilizing influence for his son. When Danny begins relating unsettling stories about Rick, Frank at first chalks it up to youthful rebellion, but when Danny stridently claims to have witnessed his new stepfather committing murder, Frank's instincts tell him the story is true. As he investigates the new man in his family's life, Frank uncovers alarming facts about Rick, who's not the man he appears to be. Domestic Disturbance (2001) made headlines six months before its release when co-star Steve Buscemi, accompanied by Vaughn and screenwriter Scott Rosenberg, was stabbed and seriously injured in an after-hours bar brawl with locals near the film's North Carolina set(n)

programme.title: The Express
programme.desc: Finding Forrester star Rob Brown steps into the cleats of Heisman Trophy-winning gridiron giant Ernie Davis in director Gary Fleder's inspirational sports docudrama. As a young boy reared not far from the northern Pennsylvania state line, Davis dreamed of blasting through the end zone and scoring a triumphant touchdown while fans rose to their feet and cheered. When Davis later became a star running back for the Syracuse Orangemen, his dreams were finally on the way to becoming a reality. Under the wing of coach Ben Schwartzwalder (Dennis Quaid), it seemed as if there is nothing that could stop Davis from entering into the annals of sports history; even during an era in which the civil rights movement was just gaining momentum, this fledgling gridiron giant never once doubted his ability to rise to the top. When Davis was diagnosed with leukemia shortly after being drafted into the NFL, however, his will to survive soon eclipsed his dreams of success(n)

programme.title: Pitch Black
programme.desc: Crew of crashed space transport tackle fellow passenger Riddick (Diesel), a serial murderer. The true threat to the crew turns out to be the planet's flesh eating nocturnal creatures(n)

programme.title: The Hand that Rocks the Cradle
programme.desc: A widow poses as a nanny to seek revenge against a new mother, who does not know that their pasts are intertwined(n)

programme.title: Wish I Was Here
programme.desc: A 35-year-old father (Zach Braff) who's never quite grown up learns about life when he's forced to homeschool his kids, since their grandpa can no longer afford their private-school tuition and their public school is a mess(n)

programme.title: Dumb and Dumber
programme.desc: Slapstick comedy about a pair of idiotic friends who set off on a madcap journey to return a briefcase to its owner. However, they are blissfully unaware that the case contains a large amount of ransom money for the owner's kidnapped husband. Their trip is soon fraught with disaster, especially when the kidnappers begin to pursue them across the country with the aim of grabbing the cash(n)

programme.title: Forgetting Sarah Marshall
programme.desc: In desperate need of a vacation after being unceremoniously dumped by his TV-star girlfriend, a man travels to a lavish Hawaiian resort to nurse his wounds and forget his heartache, only to discover that his ex and her handsome new boyfriend are currently staying at the exact same island hot spot. Peter Bretter (Jason Segel) may be just another struggling musician, but for the past six years he's been dating Sarah Marshall (Kristen Bell), one of the hottest stars on television. Sarah is everything in the world to Peter, so when she kindly but firmly tells him that they should each go their separate ways, he is absolutely devastated. Later, after attempting to salvage his ego by awkwardly attempting to become a womanizer and nearly losing his job because of a nervous breakdown, an emotionally fragile Peter attempts to put the past behind him by escaping to the sun-soaked beaches of Oahu. While at first it seems as if Peter has discovered the perfect prescription for a bad case of lost love, his plan soon turns to dust when Sarah and her new rock-star boyfriend, Aldous (Russell Brand), turn up at the exact same resort. Though accepting Sarah's lavish new lifestyle won't be easy for the crestfallen Peter, the laid-back companionship of flirtatious resort employee Rachel (Mila Kunis) -- not to mention a continuous regimen of fruity cocktails -- goes a long way in mending the wounds of a broken heart. Forgetting Sarah Marshall was penned by Segel and produced by Judd Apatow. Fun with Dick and Jane screenwriter Nicholas Stoller makes his directorial debut. The cast also includes Paul Rudd, Bill Hader, Jack McBrayer, and Jonah Hill(n)

programme.title: 5 Star Max Programming
programme.desc: No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: I Love You, Man
programme.desc: Friendless Peter Klaven goes on a series of man-dates to find a Best Man for his wedding. But when his insta-bond with his new B.F.F. puts a strain on his relationship with his fiancée, can the trio learn to live happily ever after?(n)

programme.title: The Wash
programme.desc: Sean is financially strapped and on the verge of losing his home and his car until his roommate Dee Loc suggests he joins him as an employee at the local car wash. Tension mounts between the pals when the establishment's eccentric owner Mr. Washington promotes the more mature and responsible Sean over Dee Loc. However, when their boss is kidnapped, Sean and Dee Loc must work together to save their employer, their jobs, and their friendship(n)

programme.title: Baby Mama
programme.desc: Former Saturday Night Live "Weekend Update" co-anchors Tina Fey and Amy Poehler co-star in this baby-fever comedy about a single, career-oriented woman who previously put parenthood on hold, and is forced to hire a surrogate mother when she discovers there is only a one-in-a-million chance that she will be able to get pregnant. Kate Holbrook (Fey) is a 37-year-old business executive who has always put her professional life before her personal life, but these days her biological clock is ticking louder than ever before. As with everything else she has accomplished in life, Kate is determined to have a child on her own terms. Unfortunately for Kate, the chance of her ever becoming pregnant is slim to none. Undaunted, a willful Kate drafts South Philly working-class girl Angie Ostrowiski (Poehler) -- a woman who may just be her polar opposite -- to be a surrogate mother. Subsequently informed by the head of the surrogacy center (Sigourney Weaver) that her surrogate is indeed pregnant, the excited mother-to-be soon purchases every child-rearing book she can find and excitedly begins the nesting process. But life hasn't quit throwing Kate curveballs just yet, because when a pregnant Angie shows up on her doorstep with no place to live, the woman who once thrived on order finds her life descending into chaos. Now, as Kate attempts to transform Angie into the ideal expectant mother, this odd couple will discover that families aren't always biological, but occasionally formed through friendship as well. Writer Michael McCullers, who authored the screenplays for Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me and Undercover Brother in addition to working on Saturday Night Live, makes his feature directorial debut with a self-penned screenplay(n)

programme.title: Keeping the Faith
programme.desc: Terrific, lively comedy about two pals who grow up with the same vocation; one becomes a rabbi, the other a Catholic priest. But their faith and friendship are tested when an old schoolfriend shows up in town(n)

programme.title: National Treasure
programme.desc: Action drama in which a treasure hunter (Nicholas Cage) finds the map to a secret war chest hidden by America's Founding Fathers. He is close to discovering its whereabouts, but so is his colleague-turned-enemy, and the FBI are also on the case(n)

programme.title: Hardball
programme.desc: Conor O'Neill is usually one step ahead of the loan sharks. But this time, his debts force him to accept a job coaching tough Chicago kids. Conor plans to take the money and run, but when the team starts looking up to him, he realises he'll have to take responsibility for the first time in his life(n)

programme.title: Man on the Moon
programme.desc: Comedian Andy Kaufman gave performances that were bizarre and difficult to categorize, in which he might do or say almost anything: show cartoons, impersonate Elvis Presley, play conga drums while singing children's songs, read aloud from The Great Gatsby, or take the audience out for milk and cookies. Written by Scott Alexander and Larry Karaszewski and directed by Milos Forman (the team behind The People vs. Larry Flynt (1996)), this biopic takes an in-depth look at Kaufman's life and art, with Jim Carrey as Kaufman, who could (and would) be any number of different people onstage: the quiet and childlike man, the little foreign guy, the overbearing showbiz "professional," the violently obnoxious wrestler, or the world's worst lounge singer. As Kaufman rose from comedy clubs to guest appearances on Saturday Night Live and a spot on the TV sitcom Taxi, his performances became more complex and dangerous -- so much so that when word got out in 1984 that he was suffering from lung cancer, many fans and associates thought it was just another bizarre stunt; the disease took his life later that year. Man on the Moon features Danny De Vito as Kaufman's manager George Shapiro, Courtney Love as his girlfriend Lynne Margulies, Paul Giamatti as his friend Bob Zmuda, and David Letterman, Judd Hirsch, Marilu Henner, Carol Kane, and Christopher Lloyd as themselves(n)

programme.title: The Family Man
programme.desc: Nicolas Cage is the slick financier who usually wakes up to a blonde and the Wall St Journal. But not today, because angel Don Cheadle gives him a glimpse of what might have been, with kids, a wife and a job selling tires(n)

programme.desc: Former car thief Randall Memphis Raines (Nicolas Cage) must come out of retirement to steal 50 cars in one night or his brother Kip (Giovanni Ribisi) will die. Randall enlists help from a few boost happy pals to accomplish the seemingly impossible feat. From countless car chases to relentless cops, the roadblocks Randall must swerve around to save Kip add up to high-octane excitement(n)

Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, Johnny Cash and Ida Lupino.(n)

programme.desc: A scientist is overjoyed when his son follows in his footsteps, receiving widespread acclaim for a revolutionary new theory. When a fellow boffin produces evidence of plagiarism, the ruthless father resorts to murder to save his son from a scandal. But he reckons without the dishevelled detective, who sees through his efforts to make the killing look like the work of burglars. Crime drama, with Peter Falk, Jose Ferrer and Lew Ayres.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a drone pilot whose car had recently been sprayed with the word `killer'. A member of a protest group who objected to the military's use of drones admits to harassing victim Max Griggs, and though soon discounted as a suspect, leads the team to Griggs' secret store room where an unlicensed drone is recovered. This is found to have been used to shoot footage of land surrounding several military bases and it becomes clear Griggs was apparently looking for evidence that someone did not want to be discovered. Scott Bakula and Lucas Black star.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Lachlan Colston, a lieutenant in the Royal Australian Navy, is murdered on US soil, prompting Special Investigator Naomi Parsons to travel to New Orleans from Australia to investigate. Evidence mounts suggesting that Colston's death was a hired hit, but when the team moves in to apprehend the assassin, Parsons' rash actions jeopardise the arrest. Suitably humbled, the Aussie agent agrees to tow the line as Pride and his colleagues learn that Colston may have been killed to derail a nuclear programme to be established on the Cocos Islands. Naval crime drama, starring Scott Bakula.(n)

programme.desc: Part one of two. Hanna receives a call for help from a former CIA colleague, only to find the man dead in an apparent suicide. programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Grissom announces he is leaving the team and tries to crack his final case, involving the discovery of a decomposed body. programme.desc: Benson locates her long-lost brother's house in New Jersey, only to discover he is suspected of stalking three women and breaking into their homes. programme.title: Just Go With It
programme.desc: A prominent plastic surgeon meets the woman of his dreams only to find their future thrown into jeopardy when his playboy past comes back to haunt him. Danny (Adam Sandler) has a unique approach to picking up women -- in order to break the ice and gain their sympathy, he pretends to be stuck in an unhappy marriage. The instant he brandishes his wedding ring, the deal is all but cinched. But when Danny finally meets a woman (Brooklyn Decker) that he really would want to marry, he abandons his usual approach for something a bit more subtle. Incredibly, it works. But when she discovers the wedding band that he used to use as a pick-up prop, Danny attempts to cover his tracks by falling back on his tried-and-true divorce line. Unfortunately for Danny, the plan backfires when his new girlfriend asks to meet his future ex. Desperate, Danny recruits his office manager, Katherine (Jennifer Aniston), to validate his ruse by posing as his current wife. Before long, the lies are snowballing, and by the time Katherine's kids get involved and everyone comes together for a trip to Hawaii, it's not a matter of if Danny's plan will fall through, but when(n)

With ample reason to dislike one another, Hawk and Borelli are none too happy when they are forced to collaborateon an operation in the field. Back in camp, B.J. (Mike Farrell) holds a curious "anniversary" party where everyone is invited. In addition to the guest appearance of Robert Alda, this episode also features Alan Alda's half-brother Antony Alda as an intern(n)

programme.title: M*A*S*H
programme.desc: Good-bye, Cruel World. Hawkeye (Alan Alda) and psychiatrist Sidney (Allan Arbus)tackle the problem of Sgt. Yee (Clyde Kusatsu), a much-decorated war hero. It seems that Yee's fearlessness on the battlefield is a direct result of his trying to kill himself. Meanwhile, Klinger (Jamie Farr) begins to wonder if it was such a good idea to forge Colonel Potter's name on a set of discharge papers(n)

programme.title: M*A*S*H
programme.desc: Dreams. In this near-surrealist episode, everyone at the 4077th is suffering from the fatigue of a medical crisis. Unable to go to sleep for any great length of time, the staff begins taking little cat-naps. The result is a series of dreams and nightmares that are as bizarre as anything out of a Luis Bunuel or Ingmar Bergman movie. Strangest moment: The imaginary honeymoon of Margaret Houlihan (Loretta Swit)(n)

programme.title: M*A*S*H
programme.desc: War Co-respondent. B.J. can't deny his attraction to a popular war correspondent (Susan Saint James) and struggles to remain faithful to his wife and child in California. programme.title: Breaking Bad

programme.title: Michael Clayton
programme.desc: Michael Clayton (George Clooney) handles all of the dirty work for a major New York law firm, arranging top-flight legal services and skirting through loopholes for ethically questionable clients. But when a fellow "fixer" decides to turn on the very firm they were hired to clean up for, Clayton finds himself at the center of a conspiratorial maelstrom. Once an ambitious D.A., Clayton is now a shell of his former dynamic self, thanks to a divorce, an unfortunate business venture, and astronomical debt. Though he longs to leave the cutthroat, ethically dubious world of corporate law behind, Clayton's poor financial situation and devotion to firm head Marty Bach (Sydney Pollack) leave him little choice but to remain on the job and tough it out. Meanwhile, litigator Karen Crowder (Tilda Swinton) finds her entire company's future hinging on the outcome of a multi-billion-dollar settlement overseen by Clayton's friend, star lawyer Arthur Edens (Tom Wilkinson). When Edens snaps and decides to blow the whistle on the questionable case, sabotaging the defense, Clayton must decide between his loyalty and his conscience(n)

programme.title: National Treasure
programme.desc: Action drama in which a treasure hunter (Nicholas Cage) finds the map to a secret war chest hidden by America's Founding Fathers. He is close to discovering its whereabouts, but so is his colleague-turned-enemy, and the FBI are also on the case(n)

programme.title: Double Impact
programme.desc: Martial arts extravaganza in which twin brothers, both expert fighters, are reunited after many years to seek vengeance against their parents' killer. After the murder, engineered by their father's unscrupulous business partner, the young sons are separated. One becomes a Hong Kong smuggler, the other a Beverly Hills aerobics instructor. But despite their very different lifestyles, they are united in the desire for justice(n)

programme.title: Play It to the Bone
programme.desc: After covering baseball in Bull Durham, basketball in White Men Can't Jump. and golf in Tin Cup, writer, director, and obvious sports fan Ron Shelton takes on the world of boxing in this comedy. Vince Boudreau (Woody Harrelson) and Cesar Sota (Antonio Banderas) are close friends and aspiring boxers struggling on the lowest rungs of the fight game. When a major boxing promoter needs to fill out the card for a heavyweight bout in Las Vegas, Vince and Cesar both get the call to head out to Sin City. But the excitement sours when they realize that there's a small problem: the promoter's schedule has the two pals fighting each other. Play It to the Bone also features Lolita Davidovich, Lucy Liu, Tom Sizemore, and Robert Wagner(n)

programme.desc: In this action-packed thriller, a mysterious, superhuman assassin teams with a young woman to take down a major corporation plotting to use his genetic makeup to create a race of unstoppable killers(n)

programme.title: Deepwater Horizon
programme.desc: Lone Survivor director Peter Berg helmed this docudrama about the Deepwater Horizon disaster, the 2010 oil-rig explosion in the Gulf of Mexico that resulted in the largest offshore oil spill in U.S. history. The film depicts the challenges that Mike Williams (Mark Wahlberg) and the rest of the rig's crew faced as they fought for survival. Kate Hudson, Kurt Russell, and John Malkovich co-star(n)

programme.title: Gone in 60 Seconds
programme.desc: Former car thief Randall Memphis Raines (Nicolas Cage) must come out of retirement to steal 50 cars in one night or his brother Kip (Giovanni Ribisi) will die. Randall enlists help from a few boost happy pals to accomplish the seemingly impossible feat. From countless car chases to relentless cops, the roadblocks Randall must swerve around to save Kip add up to high-octane excitement(n)

programme.title: Die Hard With a Vengeance
programme.desc: German terrorist, Simon Gruber plants a series of bombs in public places and gives clues about their whereabouts, through bizzare riddles. John McClane, a cop has to solve these riddles to stop the city from blowing up(n)

programme.title: Into the Blue
programme.desc: Into the Blue stars Paul Walker and Jessica Alba as a pair of would-be fortune hunters who look for treasure at the bottom of the ocean after hurricane season. Their happy life in the Bahamas takes a turn when they get a visit from his old childhood friend (Scott Caan and his girlfriend (Ashley Scott). The foursome eventually discover a huge supply of seemingly abandoned cargo in a plane at the bottom of the ocean. They must battle both the bad guys who own the goods, as well as the shark that live in the water(n)

programme.title: Carlito's Way: Rise to Power
programme.desc: In this belated prequel to director Brian De Palma's 1993 crime drama, gangster Carlito Brigante (Jay Hernandez) rises through the ranks of the New York underworld to establish himself as Spanish Harlem's most powerful kingpin. As the intoxication of ultimate power tightens its firm grip on the rising heroin czar, he soon learns that greed and deception are the unspoken laws of the street. With no one to trust except for his two brothers in crime, Carlito begins building an empire founded on supplying the city's addicts with the one product that is always in demand. His dreams of ruling the city finally becoming a reality, Carlito soon learns that the only way to sustain his power is through loyalty and respect. Adapted from author Edwin Torres' acclaimed novel, Carlito's Way: Rise to Power also stars Mario Van Peebles, Luis Guzmán, and Sean Combs(n)

programme.title: Never Die Alone
programme.desc: From a script from first-time scribe James Gibson comes this filmed adaptation of ex-gangster Donald Goines' 1974 novel Never Die Alone. Directed by Ernest R. Dickerson (Juice, Bones), the films stars David Arquette as Paul Pawlowski, a reporter who takes an interest in gang kingpin King David, played by rapper/actor DMX. When King David is killed, Pawlowski happens upon the criminal's journal and envelops himself in his story. From there, the rise and fall of King David is covered in flashbacks as Pawlowski makes his way through the diary. Aisha Tyler and Jennifer Sky co-star(n)

programme.title: Captain Ron
programme.desc: In this zany comedy, a family purchases a yacht once owned by acting icon Clark Gable, and decides to sail it from an island to Miami after hiring a trained sea captain to man the boat for them(n)

programme.title: Fire Down Below
programme.desc: An EPA marshal (Steven Seagal) goes undercover in a mining community to investigate the murder of a friend. He joins forces with two locals, and they embark on a quest to stop a treacherous corporation that has been illegally dumping toxic waste. Marg Helgenberger, Harry Dean Stanton, Stephen Lang(n)

programme.title: Cirque du Freak: The Vampire's Assistant
programme.desc: Based on the popular series of books by Darren Shan, Cirque du Freak: The Vampire's Assistant tells the story of a small-town teen who inadvertently shatters a 200-year-old truce between warring factions of vampires. Sixteen-year-old Darren (Chris Massoglia) is your typical adolescent; he spends most of his time with his best friend, Steve (Josh Hutcherson), earns decent grades, and generally manages to stay out of trouble. But trouble finds Darren when he and Steve make the acquaintance of a vampire named Larten Crepsley (John C. Reilly) while attending a traveling freak show at a local theater. Transformed into a bloodsucker by Crepsley, Darren joins the Cirque Du Freak and quickly ingratiates himself with the unusual cast of characters who populate it, including Madame Truska the Bearded Lady (Salma Hayek) and the traveling sideshow's towering barker (Ken Watanabe). As Darren works to master his newfound powers as a budding member of the supernatural underworld, he becomes a valued pawn between the vampires and their deadlier rivals, the Vampaneze. With tensions between the two sects intensifying, Darren must figure out a means of keeping the coming war from destroying his last vestige of humanity. Patrick Fugit, Orlando Jones, Willem Dafoe, and Jane Krakowski co-star(n)

programme.desc: Cats in Isolation. Cats In Isolation synopsis: Jackson visits a house divided, with four cats always fighting. Plus, he's at a cattery where territorial issues forced two cats to live in isolation for years(n)

programme.title: Pit Bulls & Parolees
programme.desc: A Diamond in the Rough. A midnight rescue involves uncovering a dog's origins; a cat causes problems for a Villalobos veteran; a parolee recommends a pal for a job(n)

programme.title: Pit Bulls & Parolees
programme.desc: Holiday Special. Tania spearheads an effort to find forever homes for their favorite dogs. Meanwhile, Earl rallies the parolees' festive spirits and enlists their help to decorate the Tahyo Tavern and prepare a very special Christmas feast for the Villalobos family(n)

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Old School vs. New School. Brett and Wayde attempt to transform a pinball machine into a state-of-the art aquarium. Plus, can a high-tech robot function inside a series of tanks?(n)

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Polar Opposites. Wayde is asked to build a 35ft aquarium, but with only weeks to complete the project will his design make a splash? Plus, the Ice Bar wants a cool jellyfish tank(n)

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Roll With It. The Pensacola baseball team wants to transform their old bus into a mobile fish tank for their new stadium. Plus, how do you fit an aquarium with hand dryers?(n)

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Flying High and Sinking Deep. The guys are flown to Chicago in a private jet for an unusual job. Plus, a Caribbean restaurant orders an interactive window with a side of submarines(n)

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Driving New Business. The duo are challenged to turn an entire Toyota Highlander into an aquarium while simultaneously opening a new ATM office in South Florida(n)

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Wilmer's Tank-errama. Best friends and constant rivals Wayde King and Brett Raymer are back and continuing to grow America's largest aquarium manufacturing company, Acrylic Tank Manufacturing, ATM(n)

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Pranks and Dranks!. "Jackass" producer Jeff Tremaine wants a saltwater aquarium for his man cave that features the skull-and-crutches logo, but Brett and Wayde also equip their creation with a surprise the whole daredevil crew can appreciate. Also: A smoothie franchise in Florida wants a tall, cup-shape tank with a plastic lid and straw(n)

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: SHAQ-SIZED. NBA legend Shaquille O'Neal requests a saltwater tank for his Florida mansion that is built in the front end of an 18-wheeler and has a Superman theme(n)

programme.title: Tanked

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Pete Rose Scores a Tank. Baseball legend Pete Rose wants Riverfront Stadium transformed into an aquarium. Later, Wayde and Heather travel to Horry County to build a huge aquarium(n)

programme.title: Monsters Inside Me

programme.title: Monsters Inside Me
programme.desc: The Backyard Killer. A blood infection threatens the life of a holistic health worker; a teen's lungs are shut down by an infection; a personal trainer's nervous system is attacked(n)

programme.title: Monsters Inside Me

programme.title: Meerkat Manor

programme.title: Meerkat Manor
programme.desc: The Graduate. Wilson of the Commandoes tries to woo one of the Whiskers females; Mozart meets a young male who is interested in her(n)

programme.title: Dogs 101
programme.sub-title: Bloodhound, Yorkshire Terrier, Great Dane, Shih Tzu, Rhodesian Ridgeback
programme.desc: Bloodhound, Yorkshire Terrier, Great Dane, Shih Tzu, Rhodesian Ridgeback. Which canine's nose knows it all? Which breed is among the tallest? And which pup honks like a goose? Each of these dogs has their own exceptional story to tell(n)

programme.title: Too Cute!
programme.desc: Puppies: Growing Up Fluffy. Catching up with litters of Portuguese water dog, Rhodesian ridgeback and dachshund puppies after one year(n)

programme.title: Bad Dog!

programme.title: Animal Cops: Houston
programme.desc: Tumor. When a dog is found with a tumour hanging from his neck, investigators battle to save him. In court, they have to win custody of the dog so he can receive the necessary treatment(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops: Houston

programme.title: Pit Bulls & Parolees
programme.desc: Giving Back. Meanwhile, a couple hope to adopt a pit bull after losing their previous pet; and the New Orleans arena football team recruits the twins and a pit bull named Rhino to be its on-field mascots(n)

programme.title: Pit Bulls & Parolees
programme.desc: Puppy-Palooza. A rescue mission brings Tia and daughter Mariah face to face with a protective mama dog and her litter of seven puppies, but Villalobos is overrun with puppies(n)

programme.desc: Baiters Beware. A trap thief is caught; two brothers are suspected of using bait piles for hunting; a father is allegedly raising his son to be a poacher(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features.(n)

programme.title: The Andrew Marr Show
programme.desc: A round-up of the week's stories, featuring interviews with key figures in politics and current affairs and a round-up of the Sunday papers. Including news and weather at 9.00.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Morning Live
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Emma Barnett present topical debate covering religious, moral and ethical issues, with guest panellists and contributions from viewers.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore a house in Wales that has been standing empty for 12 years, along with properties in Derbyshire and Kent. They then speak to the new owners about their plans for the buildings, and find out how much they paid for them at auction.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Experts Anita Manning and Philip Serrell help two separate teams of dog and horse lovers compete to find the best antiques at Wetherby racecourse in West Yorkshire. Plus, presenter Tim Wonnacott discovers something warm and cuddly in the V&A Museum of Childhood in east London.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a pair of returning expats find their ideal country home in North Wales for a budget of £350,000. Away from hunt, the presenter meets a local fisherman.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore saves three things from being tipped in Surrey, that she thinks she can turn a profit from for the people dumping them, including a pine door and a travelling chest.(n)

programme.title: Oz the Great and Powerful
programme.desc: An amoral circus illusionist is transported to a magical land, where he is mistaken for a powerful wizard prophesied to fall from the sky and save the realm from evil. His attempt to take advantage of the situation leads him into a dangerous quest involving three powerful witches. Fantasy adventure prequel to The Wizard of Oz, starring James Franco, Mila Kunis, Rachel Weisz and Michelle Williams.(n)

programme.title: Lifeline
programme.desc: Tom Daley presents an appeal on behalf of the Brain Tumour Charity, meeting a woman who works to raise awareness of the signs that a child may have developed a tumour.(n)

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Katherine Jenkins presents the show from Hastings, discovering how the famous battle changed the history of Christianity and meeting volunteers from a local church.(n)

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts an authors edition of the general knowledge quiz, as Germaine Greer, Kathy Lette, Mark Billingham, Val McDermid, Mark Watson, Ian McMillan, Freya North and Tony Parsons try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public. Richard Osman is the man with the answers.(n)

programme.title: Wild Alaska Live
programme.sub-title: Getting to Know our Animal Characters.
programme.desc: New series. Liz Bonnin, Matt Baker and Steve Backshall present footage of animals during the annual salmon migration, which provides a vital source of food for other wildlife. The first programme features underwater footage of the fish making their lengthy journey, as well as the bears that wait to feed on them. Plus, off the coast, walruses gather on a small island and scientists study the social groups of orcas.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: John Craven visits a conservation project for great bustards in Salisbury Plain, while Anita Rani meets contestants in the international young beekeepers' competition at Marlborough college and helps out with volunteers trying to stop one of England's most important chalk streams from dying up. Plus, artisanal flower growing in the Marlborough Downs and a farmer who keeps sheep for their milk.(n)

programme.title: Poldark
programme.desc: George plans to stand for parliament, but fails to make a good impression on a potential ally at Caroline's wedding reception and is forced to seek support elsewhere. Agatha prepares to celebrate her 100th birthday, and Hugh becomes infatuated with Demelza, although Ross dismisses the possibility. Morwenna's sister turns up at the Whitworth vicarage, and Sir Francis Bassett plans to challenge Falmouth's political monopoly in Truro, and invites Ross and Demelza to Tehidy so he can make a proposal.(n)

programme.title: Miranda Hart - My What I Call Live Show
programme.desc: A filmed performance from the comedian's nationwide stand-up tour, combining stand-up comedy, sketches, songs and dance and featuring anecdotes ranging from flatulent first dates to socially inept children.(n)

programme.title: Gambit
programme.desc: A put-upon art expert managing the collection of an obnoxious millionaire hatches a plan to get revenge. With the aid of a forger and a Texan rodeo performer, he fakes the discovery of a previously unheard-of Monet painting, intending to trick his greedy employer into parting with a fortune to get his hands on it. Comedy remake, starring Colin Firth, Cameron Diaz and Alan Rickman.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Wild UK
programme.desc: New series. Zoologist Lucy Cooke and wildlife cameraman Colin Stafford-Johnson explore the nation's wildernesses to reveal the wildlife that exists there, beginning with its rivers.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore properties about to be auctioned in North Yorkshire, Stoke-on-Trent and Tunbridge Wells. The presenters then talk to the new owners about their plans for the buildings - including a couple who have fallen in love with a converted stable block that needs a lot of work.(n)

programme.title: Food: Truth or Scare
programme.desc: Chris Bavin and Gloria Hunniford investigate claims that oily fish may not be the wonder food it is often said to be after reports stated it could even be dangerous.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays
programme.desc: Angela Rippon, Gloria Hunniford and Julia Somerville report on companies that promise safe and secure airport parking, but leave cars in fields or by the side of the road.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles is joined at an antiques fair at Wetherby Racecourse by experts Nick Hall and Jonathan Pratt, who help two teams buy three items to take to auction in Darlington.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: Angela suggests moving as a way to help Conor, Adrijan is looking for a way to control his anger and Rachel's affections are torn.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah is on the Dorset coast with a couple hoping to find literary inspiration and seaside serenity for their £500,000 budget. She also meets a pair of inspired printmakers.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore saves three things from being tipped in Witley, Surrey, that she thinks she can turn a profit from for the people dumping them, one of which is an inspiring old chair.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: From Gloucester Cathedral, presenter Paul Martin, along with experts Catherine Southon and Philip Serrell, views some exceptional items brought in for valuation.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Documentary celebrating inspirational agricultural families and the events where they showcase their hard work. Dairy farmers Ben and Holly from Eynsford, Kent, come up against neighbour and friend Trevor from Guston at the Edenbridge & Oxted Agricultural Show in Surrey.(n)

programme.title: Jodi's Lovely Letters
programme.desc: Aled Jones meets Jodi Ann Bickley, who has ME and has established the project One Million Lovely Letters in 2013. Since then, the Birmingham resident has been dubbed `the girl who writes letters' after submitting thousands of missives to people around the world, offering support to those who need it. Part of the One Lives strand. First shown on BBC One West Midlands.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Recent events send shockwaves through the Square and as one resident realises their life may never be the same again, another sets out to get revenge. Lauren pushes Steven to tell Ian and Jane his news, but he refuses - and then makes another shocking announcement. Max finds what he needs from Carmel's files - what is he up to?.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.sub-title: Men, Boys and Eating Disorders - Panorama.
programme.desc: International rugby union referee Nigel Owens meets men, boys and their families from across the UK to hear their moving accounts of the devastating impact of anorexia and bulimia, as he sets out to investigate the reasons behind why increasing numbers of males are being diagnosed. Nigel also opens up about his own eating disorder for the first time, as he confronts a dark truth about his battle with bulimia.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Dartford.
programme.desc: Nick Knowles travels to Dartford to meet Scott and Jenny, whose third son Charlie was born with cerebral palsy and developmental delay. The boy needs round-the-clock care, which his mother gave up work to provide, but now he is 13, the family are struggling to cope in their small home. Having heard of their plight, the DIY SOS team turns up to transform their end terrace, backed up by an army of local tradespeople, with designer Naomi Cleaver on hand to ensure they don't stray too far from her vision.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kay's Comedy Shuffle
programme.desc: The comedian, actor, writer and director looks back on his eventful career. Both Peter and his Phoenix Nights character Brian Potter receive mysterious phone calls, while in Car Share John and Kayleigh discuss naturists on their way home. Amy Winehouse also appears.(n)

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You.
programme.desc: Comedian Jo Brand hosts an extended edition of the satirical current affairs quiz from October 2016, with former Liberal Democrats leader Tim Farron and football pundit Chris Kamara joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's news.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: A to Z of TV Gardening
programme.desc: Carol Kirkwood looks at subjects beginning with the letter W, continuing her alphabetical journey through the world of horticulture. Along the way, she gets inspiration and advice from some of the BBC's most popular gardening presenters.(n)

programme.title: The Instant Gardener
programme.desc: Helen Skelton and Danny Clarke are in Abingdon, Oxfordshire, helping a mother install wheelchair access and bring a bit of colour to her neglected garden for her young daughter.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don visits a floral paradise outside of Dublin and discovers how Jimi Blake fills his garden with flora for free. Elsewhere, Nicky Bailey demonstrates how to transform a bland patio into a space that looks incredible at twilight, and Mark Lane travels to Oldham to visit the newly opened Maggie's Centre.(n)

programme.title: The Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Carole Baxter and Jim McColl harvest ripe cherries in the fruit house, and Jim visits a Montrose couple who, with little previous experience, have created a haven of colour in their garden. Carole meets two passionate showers who are entering the Dundee Flower Show - Alistair Gray in Brechin, winner of the 2016 world potato championship, and Bruce McLeod in Meigle, who grows champion chrysanthemums.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Ellie Harrison visits a Scottish island that is home to the largest puffin colony on Britain's east coast, and Sean Fletcher investigates the history of fruit growing in Fife. Plus, Tom Heap reports on the spread of bovine TB among goats and Adam Henson joins a member of Ordnance Survey as he maps field margins.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents highlights of the series, recalling his favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Nigel Slater: Eating Together
programme.desc: Nigel's final leg of his tour of modern British home cooking explores the flair and flamboyance of noodles, including his own rustic take on old-fashioned spaghetti bolognese. Steffi introduces him to the German art of noodle-making from scratch using a traditional spatzle board, and he is also shown Spanish and Thai recipes as he meets two other home cooks. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore food-related customs associated with wedding ceremonies. The duo help prepare a Scottish breakfast fit for a bride and groom, and highlight traditions behind the star of the nuptial feast - the cake.(n)

programme.title: Diving: World Championships
programme.desc: Highlights from the competition at Danube Arena in Budapest, Hungary, which featured both individual and synchronised events on the 1m and 3m springboards, and the 10m platform.(n)

programme.title: Wanted Down Under
programme.desc: The Lloyds sample life in Adelaide, Australia, wishing to start afresh after a series of unfortunate events. They also hope the country's attitude to sun safety will mean their son Riley, who was born with albinism, will cope with his condition better. Nicki Chapman presents.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Mat Pines' five-year study of the lives of hamadryas baboons in Ethiopia, in which he lived alongside the primates in the Awash National Park, observing their behaviour and gaining acceptance in their society. As his project draws to a close, his favourite baboon, who he has called Critical, is trying to find a family and fend off male rivals - while Mat attempts to foster a greater understanding of the creatures among the local Afar tribe, which has traditionally regarded them as enemies. Narrated by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Antiques experts Michael Baggott and Caroline Hawley inspect an oriental carving and a model of a Second World War V1 bomb brought in by members of the public looking to make a sale at Derbyshire's Haddon Hall. Plus, presenter Paul Martin explores the history of the Peak District National Park.(n)

programme.title: Live Swimming: World Championships
programme.desc: Helen Skelton presents coverage of day one from Danube Arena in Budapest, Hungary, which will include the finals of the women's and men's 400m freestyle disciplines, as well as the 4x100m freestyle relay events. With expert analysis from Rebecca Adlington and Mark Foster.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: New series. Gregg Wallace, Cherry Healey and Ruth Goodman investigate the origins and production of more household staples, beginning with tea. Gregg looks at the factory that produces one quarter of all the tea drunk in Britain. Meanwhile, Cherry Healey examines an African tea processing plant, and Ruth Goodman sheds light on how Second World War troops risked their lives to brew up.(n)

programme.title: Golf: The Open
programme.desc: Eilidh Barbour present highlights of the final day of the prestigious event, which took place at Royal Birkdale Golf Club in Southport. The winner of this year's tournament would not only get to lift the famous Claret Jug, but add their name to an illustrious list of champions that includes the likes of Jack Nicklaus, Arnold Palmer, Tiger Woods and Seve Ballesteros, and should a British player emerge victorious they will have been the first to do so since Paul Lawrie in 1999. Commentary by Peter Allis, Ken Brown and Andrew Cotter.(n)

programme.title: Maps to the Stars
programme.desc: Premiere. A disfigured woman is hired as an assistant to a fading Hollywood star, who has become obsessed with her dead mother and is determined to recreate her most famous film role. Meanwhile, a teen idol goes off the rails under the influence of his overbearing parents and a chauffeur harbours dreams of becoming a writer. David Cronenberg's drama, starring Julianne Moore, Mia Wasikowska, John Cusack and Robert Pattinson.(n)

programme.title: The Skin I Live In
programme.desc: A plastic surgeon creates synthetic human skin that is indistinguishable from the real thing. However, nobody knows that he has accomplished this goal by experimenting on a woman he keeps as a hostage in his home - until his maid's criminal son invades the house, and secrets begin coming to light. Pedro Almodovar's thriller, starring Antonio Banderas and Elena Anaya. In Spanish.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Ellie Harrison visits a Scottish island that is home to the largest puffin colony on Britain's east coast, and Sean Fletcher investigates the history of fruit growing in Fife. Plus, Tom Heap reports on the spread of bovine TB among goats and Adam Henson joins a member of Ordnance Survey as he maps field margins.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Essie worries that she is not being a good foster parent to Parker, but determined to take all the responsibility herself, she is reluctant to accept any help from Raf. Meanwhile, a tricky patient diagnosis throws Morven straight in at the deep end on her first day back, and Matteo recruits an unenthusiastic Jac to work with Damon on his assessment day.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Actress and comedian Nina Wadia joins Brian Conley to look back at her favourite TV, including programmes starring Bruce Willis, Michael Crawford and Mr T.(n)

programme.title: Right on the Money
programme.desc: The team helps an occupational therapist whose spending on her family and friends is causing her to go into the red. With Dominic Littlewood and Denise Lewis. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Anita Manning hosts as Paul Laidlaw and John Cameron help teams select items at the antiques fair at the Royal Highland Centre, Edinburgh, in the hope of making a profit at auction.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs Tom Brown, Andy Clatworthy and returning competitor Dominic Chapman continue the battle to cook at a Taste of Summer banquet celebrating 140 years of the Wimbledon Championships. As each of them prepare their desserts, they will all be out to impress as only two can make it through to tomorrow's South West final.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining South West chefs compete for a place in the national finals, preparing their entire menus for judges Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort, Andi Oliver and guest judge Marion Regan. Marion's farm provides the famous Wimbledon strawberries to the Championships, so her involvement is entirely suitable given the ongoing tennis theme to the series.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Athletics
programme.desc: Gabby Logan introduces action from the 11th meeting of the season, which took place at Stade Louis II, and was expected to feature Usain Bolt in the 100m.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents the quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: The Best Dishes Ever
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott introduces dishes that are good to make in advance, including Mary Berry's fresh fruit salad, James Martin's chicken stew, the Hairy Bikers' autumn pudding, Nigel Slater's bean soup, and Nigella Lawson's ice-cream cake.(n)

programme.title: This Wild Life
programme.desc: Wildlife expert Saba Douglas-Hamilton, her husband Frank Pope and their three young children move to the Samburu National Reserve in Kenya, where she is taking over the running of a safari camp. Things get off to a rocky start when guests arrive earlier than expected and an elephant emergency pushes everyone to their limits. Has the family got what it takes to survive their new life? Julian Rhind-Tutt narrates.(n)

programme.title: Super Senses: The Secret Power of Animals
programme.desc: Biologist Patrick Aryee and physicist Helen Czerski explore the world of animal senses to reveal how they detect things beyond the limits of human perception, conducting experiments and demonstrations featuring a variety of species. They begin by investigating sight and reveal how caribou - wild reindeer of Alaska - use ultraviolet light to avoid their predators. They also discover how the dragonfly's ability to view things in slow motion allows it to make a kill, and show how a snake can see in the pitch dark without using its eyes.(n)

programme.title: Live Swimming: World Championships
programme.desc: Helen Skelton presents coverage of day two from Danube Arena in Budapest, Hungary, which will include the final of the men's 100m breaststroke discipline, as well as the women's 200m individual medley and the men's and women's 100m butterfly events. With expert analysis from Rebecca Adlington and Mark Foster. Coverage continues on the interactive service.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Letterbox
programme.desc: Game show hosted by Mel Giedroyc in which pairs of contestants go head-to-head to crack a series of passwords as they attempt to take home the £2,500 prize money.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Actresses Jennifer Saunders and Patricia Potter take to the road with experts Philip Serrell and Mark Stacey. They travel through Berkshire, Hampshire and Oxfordshire on a hunt for items to sell at an auction in Greenwich, south London.(n)

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: In the second of the student quiz's first-round matches, four students from Trinity College, Cambridge, pit their wits against a team from the University of Bristol in a bid to reach the second stage of the competition. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions.(n)

programme.title: Nadiya's British Food Adventure
programme.desc: Nadiya Hussain explores the culinary traditions of the Peak District and surrounding areas, beginning by putting her own twist on the classic Bakewell tart. She then joins Ian Barrett to learn how to make Derbyshire oatcakes, before using them as a casing for her potato and dill samosas.(n)

programme.title: Ripper Street
programme.desc: Reid has finally captured Nathaniel Dove, ridding Whitechapel of its most feared monster since Jack the Ripper and also clearing the name of the late Bennet Drake. But for the detective and Jackson to be proven innocent, they must bring down Assistant Commissioner Augustus Dove. Even then, could Reid ever find peace in Whitechapel - the place which has haunted his dreams for so long? Last-ever episode of the crime drama set in the Victorian London, starring Matthew Macfadyen, Adam Rothenberg and Killian Scott. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Normal for Norfolk
programme.desc: Desmond MacCarthy ponders whether he will be the last of the MacCarthys to make Wiveton Hall their home. Elsewhere on the farm, a crisis in the cafe's water supply prompts Desmond to go looking for an ancient water well, and he and his son Edmund head out on a night shoot hunting for rats.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: The Mash Report
programme.desc: New series. Comedian Nish Kumar presents this satirical and surreal take on the week's news, with a team of correspondents keeping viewers up to date with everything that has happened - or not happened - this week.(n)

programme.title: Cleverman
programme.desc: New series. In the near-future in Australia, ancient species the Hairypeople find themselves persecuted and exploited by humans. Sci-fi drama, starring Hunter Page-Lochard.(n)

programme.title: BBC Proms 2017
programme.desc: Bernard Haitink conducts the Chamber Orchestra of Europe in a concert from the Royal Albert Hall, featuring his own Prague Symphony, Schumann's Second Symphony, and violinist Isabelle Faust performing Mozart's Third Violin Concerto.(n)

programme.title: Operation Crossbow
programme.desc: The little-known story of Spitfire pilots and Allied technicians whose work helped to thwart the Nazis during the Second World War. The programme reveals how stereoscopic 3D photographs were used to help interpreters map every contour of the enemy's territory, and uses personal testimony, computer-generated imagery and original wartime pictures to detail how the initiative was able to uncover some of Hitler's most dangerous secrets. Narrated by Samantha Bond.(n)

programme.title: Storyville
programme.sub-title: Storyville: Accidental Anarchist: Life without Government.
programme.desc: Former diplomat Carne Ross lost all faith in Western democracy after the Iraq war. This film follows him as he travels the world in search of an alternative way of living, embracing anarchist ideas as he visits a farming collective, the Occupy Wall Street protest and war-torn Syria.(n)

programme.title: After Life: The Strange Science of Decay
programme.desc: Entomologist George McGavin explores the science of decay in an experiment at Edinburgh Zoo, using microscopes and time-lapse cameras to investigate what happens when the contents of a typical kitchen and garden are left to rot for eight weeks. He reveals how moulds, microbes and insects break down foods and everyday objects, and explains why these processes are vital in nature.(n)

programme.title: Dissected
programme.desc: Part two of two. A team of anatomy experts, led by Dr George McGavin, dissects a real human foot. They aim to reveal how feet are integral to mankind's physical achievements - from a baby taking its first steps to a ballerina dancing on pointe.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Whale Hunters: The Untold Story
programme.desc: In the second of two programmes exploring the work of whale hunters in the 20th century, writer Adam Nicolson visits South Georgia - a British overseas territory in the Atlantic - where the world's largest whaling station once stood, before it was abandoned in the 1960s. The presenter considers what life was like on the island during the industry's prime in the 1920s, when up to 8,000 whales a year were processed to satisfy Europe's demand for fat.(n)

programme.title: Neil Diamond: Electric Prom
programme.desc: The singer-songwriter performs a selection of his greatest hits and cover versions from his album Dreams, accompanied by a six-piece band, at London's Roundhouse in 2010. The concert explores the songs he loves from the 1960s and 70s, and reinvents his classic tracks.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: Royal Welsh Show
programme.desc: New series. Kate Humble presents highlights from the opening day of the event that celebrates agricultural and rural life in Wales, held at the showground in Llanelwedd, Powys. Gareth Wyn Jones gets up close with the cattle and the working dogs, while Rachel de Thame swaps tips with the vegetable and flower growers.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Horizon: 10 Things You Need to Know About the Future.
programme.desc: Mathematician Hannah Fry is joined by a selection of BBC science experts to investigate the British public's questions about the future, trying to discover whether people could live for ever and if there will be a cure for cancer. Hannah examines the future of transport and if it will be possible to ditch fossil fuels, looks at what the weather will be like and discovers if the planet is on the verge of another mass extinction.(n)

programme.title: The Joy of Stats
programme.desc: Karolinska Institute professor Hans Roslin presents a light-hearted exploration of the world of statistics, looking into their history and how they work mathematically. He also examines modern examples of the use of numerical data, including the San Francisco police department's street-by-street crime map, and Google's translation project that does not require linguists. With contributions by data designer David McCandless, website founder Sep Kamvar and Cambridge professor David Spiegelhalter.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Science of Pop
programme.desc: Evolutionary biologist Professor Armand Leroi gathers a team of scientists and researchers to analyse more than 50 years of UK chart music. When the results are in, Armand teams up with producer Trevor Horn. Using machine-learning techniques, they try to take a song by unsigned artist Nike Jemiyo and turn it into a potential chart-topper.(n)

programme.title: Ocean Giants
programme.desc: Stephen Fry narrates this documentary exploring the vocal ranges of marine mammals. Sperm whales produce clicks to locate giant squid two miles beneath the ocean surface, and narwhals use a similar technique to find breathing holes in Arctic ice floes. Bottlenose dolphins communicate with fishermen in Brazil, humpbacks offer haunting operatic performances and boto dolphins create bat-like ultrasonic calls to help find fish in the murky Amazon River.(n)

programme.title: Confessions of a Shopaholic
programme.desc: Based upon Sophie Kinsella's series of books, 'Confessions of a Shopaholic' is the story of a typical Manhattan girl who struggles with her debilitating obsession over shopping. Rebecca Bloomwood's buying sprees have buried her in immense debt. She dreams about landing a job at her favorite fashion magazine as a way to transform her addiction into something that could really benefit her professionally. But unintentionally (and ironically) she ends up being hired as an advice columnist at a financial magazine. Rebecca's innovative comparisons and unconventional metaphors for economics grant her critical acclaim. Meanwhile, as she teeters on the brink of bankruptcy, she gradually begins to reassess her priorities in life(n)

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Comedian Joe Pasquale, presenters Dominic Littlewood and Kirsten O'Brien, comedy actress Cleo Rocos, actor Chris Parker (EastEnders), Olympic gold medal-winner Sally Gunnell, Loose Women host Andrea McLean, model Danielle Lloyd, and TMi Friday hosts Sam Nixon and Mark Rhodes are the second lot of foolhardy stars to take on the challenge of the Argentinian obstacle course. Before them stands a series of almost impossible physical challenges, including the now-legendary Big Balls and the Sweeper, a test of both balance and high-jumping skills. Dizzy Dummies ensures only the straightest will make it through to the final, and the winner will lift both the trophy and a £10,000 cheque for charity. Richard Hammond presents the fun from the comfort of the studio, with Amanda Byram chatting to the contestants in Argentina.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help two couples house-hunting in north-west London. Tony and Michelle have already looked at almost 100 properties during their search for a £900,000 dream pad with enough space for their large record collection. Meanwhile, Amy and Takbir are desperate to get on the first rung of the ladder, but despite some military-style planning, have had no success in the competitive market.(n)

programme.title: Last Man Standing
programme.desc: Mike is forced to attend Grandparents Day at Boyd's school, and the situation makes Vanessa self-conscious about her appearance. Comedy, starring Nancy Travis and Tim Allen.(n)

programme.title: Last Man Standing
programme.desc: Mike's daughters decide not to celebrate Halloween with him, so he tries to find someone who shares his enthusiasm for the holiday. Comedy, starring Tim Allen.(n)

programme.title: Last Man Standing
programme.desc: The all-male Outdoor Man's softball team agrees to let women play, leaving Mike with a big decision to make, and Kristin thinks about her future. Comedy, starring Tim Allen, Alexandra Krosney and Molly Ephraim.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra's accusation that Ray is pessimistic stirs him into adopting a more positive outlook, but the rest of the family is not impressed by his change in attitude. Figure skater Katarina Witt guests stars in the comedy, with Ray Romano.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray brings home a stray bulldog that reminds him of his childhood pet. Comedy, starring Ray Romano.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Bulldog overhears Frasier saying he is about to be sacked and quits his job at the radio station before the axe falls. Comedy, starring Dan Butler and Kelsey Grammer.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The sudden death of Martin's seemingly healthy doctor gives Frasier an unpleasant reminder of his own mortality. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and John Mahoney.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Brunch
programme.desc: Tim Lovejoy and Simon Rimmer are joined by guests Jada Pinkett Smith, Rita Ora, Nish Kumar and John Craven. With music from Slaves.(n)

programme.title: Eat the Week
programme.desc: Simon Rimmer provides recipes for affordable meals, including jerk chicken and treacle tart, while Michela Chiappa investigates how offal is making a comeback.(n)

programme.title: Eragon
programme.desc: A young farm boy discovers a dragon's egg, which hatches into the last surviving specimen of its mighty race. His friendship with the winged creature soon comes in handy when he discovers he is destined to overthrow the evil tyrant who has taken control of the kingdom. Fantasy adventure, starring Ed Speleers, Jeremy Irons, Robert Carlyle and Sienna Guillory, with Rachel Weisz providing the voice of the dragon.(n)

programme.title: The Restoration Man
programme.desc: Architect George Clarke meets restoration novices Mark Hinchcliffe and Laura Rushton, who have embarked upon a risky plan to convert two crumbling church buildings into family homes. The entire project hangs on them making a success of the first building, an old listed Sunday school, because they plan to use the profits from its sale to turn the second building - a cavernous Victorian church - into their own home. It soon becomes clear they are born restorers - but hidden costs threaten to compromise their standards.(n)

programme.title: Homes by the Sea
programme.desc: Charlie Luxton explores Liverpool's waterfront, before heading across the Mersey to the Wirral peninsula, where he enjoys a home inspired by Hollywood mansions. Last in the series. Previously shown on More4.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.sub-title: World Para Athletics Championships London 2017: Day 10.
programme.desc: Lee McKenzie, Ade Adepitan and Sophie Morgan present coverage of the evening session on the final day of the Championships, which takes place at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park. Despite being the last day of competition there are still 13 gold medals to be decided tonight, including the men's T54 5,000m, and the women's T44 200m and T53 800m. With analysis from Jonnie Peacock, Liam Malone, Danny Crates, Stef Reid and Millie Knight, and commentary by John Rawling, Rob Walker and Katharine Merry.(n)

programme.title: UEFA Euro 2017 Live
programme.sub-title: UEFA Women's Euro 2017: England v Spain.
programme.desc: England v Spain (Kick-off 7.45pm). Coverage of the second match in Group D for both sides, which takes place at Rat Verlegh Stadion in Breda, Netherlands. These nations were also drawn in the same group as each other at the 2013 staging of the tournament, and on that occasion it was Spain who emerged triumphant, with the 3-2 victory helping them to qualify for the knockout stage, while England crashed out at the first hurdle. Presented by Clare Balding, with expert analysis from Ian Wright, Eniola Aluko and Kim Little, and commentary by Steve Bower and Lucy Ward.(n)

programme.title: The Handmaid's Tale
programme.desc: Offred agrees to take on a mission set for her by the May Day movement, but finds the assignment they have in mind is all but impossible. Janine finally cracks when she is forced to give up her baby and move to a new posting, and resorts to drastic action to force the leaders of Gilead to notice the injustice of their society. Serena Joy tries to make a connection with Rita, and begins to suspect her husband of infidelity.(n)

programme.title: Kingdom of Heaven

programme.title: Whitney and Bobby: Addicted to Love
programme.desc: Documentary drama exploring the story of Whitney Houston and Bobby Brown's relationship from 1990 through to her death in 2012. Through first-hand testimony, analysis and comment the film reveals how the pressures of fame coupled with other issues helped sow the seeds of destruction for their marriage. The start of the millennium saw the final years of their marriage through to divorce and finally Whitney's untimely death, followed by the more recent death of their daughter Bobbi Kristina in 2015.(n)

programme.title: Whitney Houston: Her Greatest Hits
programme.desc: A celebration of the performer's most popular songs and music videos, from her first number one, 1985's Saving All My Love for You, to her 1992 version of I Will Always Love You. The programme also reveals little-known facts behind the creation of each of Houston's greatest hits.(n)
