programme.title: The Kidnapping of Shergar
programme.desc: In February 1983, Epsom Derby winner Shergar was abducted from his home at the Ballymany Stud in Co Kildare by an armed gang and taken away in a trailer. More than three decades on, the racehorse's fate remains a mystery. This documentary traces the life and career of Shergar and speculates on how the crime unfolded, featuring interviews with key witnesses.(n)

programme.title: The Railways That Built Britain with Chris Tarrant
programme.desc: The broadcaster examines how trains transformed the nation and shaped modern Britain. He begins in the cab of Puffing Billy, the world's oldest-surviving steam locomotive, which was built in 1813 and designed to move coal along a five-mile stretch of track from a Northumberland mine to the docks. Chris also tells the story of Henry Booth, who not only championed George Stephenson's famous Rocket, but also helped finance it, and talks about the work of the navvies who dug the tunnels and laid the tracks.(n)

programme.title: Great Artists
programme.desc: Tim Marlow explores the life and work of 17th-century artist Peter Paul Rubens, who enjoyed an active and eventful career. He was regarded as the chief exponent of the Baroque style, merging the grace of the Italian High Renaissance with the realism and landscapes of the northern tradition, and was perhaps best known for painting voluptuous female nudes within large-scale mythological allegories.(n)

programme.title: Wildlife SOS

programme.title: Broken Lizard's Club Dread
programme.desc: The Broken Lizard comedy troupe is the brain trust behind this slasher-movie spoof, in which a killer stalks tourists at a holiday resort(n)

programme.title: The Amityville Horror
programme.desc: One of the most celebrated horror films of the late '70s is given a new look in this remake, produced by blockbuster filmmaker Michael Bay. George and Kathy Lutz (Ryan Reynolds and Melissa George) are a young couple who are looking for a new home, and think they've found a dream house in Amityville, Long Island -- a large and beautiful home available at a bargain price. George thinks that there must be a catch, and learns that the house has a dark history -- a year before, a man living in the house murdered his family in their sleep, claiming he was commanded to commit the crime by demons. Shrugging off stories that the house is haunted, George and Kathy move in with their three kids, only to discover that something evil lurks within the house, and even Father McNamara (Philip Baker Hall), an expert on possession, is powerless to clear the dark spirits from the home. The Amityville Horror was based on the same book by Jay Anson that provided the basis for the 1979 film, which in turn documented an actual incident(n)

programme.title: Enter the Dragon
programme.desc: Bruce Lee uses a martial arts tournament as the pretext to infiltrate the island fortress of a one-armed drug baron. Forget the story, watch the moves(n)

programme.title: The Wedding Singer
programme.desc: Romantic comedy about a failed songwriter-turned-singer who makes a living on the wedding circuit in the 1980s. After being jilted at his own wedding, he becomes disillusioned about romance, but his spirits are soon lifted by a waitress who works at the same events. (Including five News Update)(n)

programme.title: Anything Else
programme.desc: A young artist struggling with his career and his muse is getting more than a little aggravation from Cupid in this romantic comedy written and directed by Woody Allen. Jerry Falk (Jason Biggs) is a promising 21-year-old comedy writer living in New York City. While Jerry has talent, he's having a hard time getting his career off the ground, which might have something to do with the fact his agent Harvey (Danny DeVito) is a well-meaning, but ineffectual, blowhard, and his mentor David Dobel (Allen) is an increasingly paranoid eccentric whose twin careers as a teacher and standup comic are both floundering. Poised at the top of Jerry's mountain of anxieties is his relationship with his girlfriend Amanda (Christina Ricci); from the first moment he saw her, Jerry has been in love with her, but Amanda's multiple neuroses, fear of commitment, and frustrating intimacy issues make her all but impossible to be around. Jerry is approaching his breaking point when the small flat he shares with Amanda becomes home to a third roommate -- Amanda's mother Paula (Stockard Channing), who has decided to come to New York to chase her dream of becoming a cabaret singer. Anything Else also features supporting performances from Jimmy Fallon, William Hill, and jazz vocalist Diana Krall(n)

programme.title: The Informant!
programme.desc: A high-level executive blows the whistle on his corrupt employers, but as he gathers inside information the FBI discover he might not be the most reliable source(n)

programme.title: Cinemax Programming
programme.desc: No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: Zoolander
programme.desc: Ben Stiller directs and stars in this satire on the fashion industry as the eponymous Zoolander, an air-head male model who's eclipsed by the equally vacuous Hansel. To make matters worse, fashion designer Mugatu plans to turn Zoolander into an international assassin(n)

programme.title: Cinemax Programming
programme.desc: No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: Aliens
programme.desc: Big-budget special effects, swiftly paced action, and a distinct feminist subtext from writer/director James Cameron turned what should have been a by-the-numbers sci-fi sequel into both a blockbuster and a seven-time Oscar nominee. Sigourney Weaver returns as Ellen Ripley, the last surviving crew member of a corporate spaceship destroyed after an attack by a vicious, virtually unbeatable alien life form. Adrift in space for half a century, Ripley grapples with depression until she's informed by her company's representative, Carter Burke (Paul Reiser) that the planet where her crew discovered the alien has since been settled by colonists. Contact with the colony has suddenly been lost, and a detachment of colonial marines is being sent to investigate. Invited along as an advisor, Ripley predicts disaster, and sure enough, the aliens have infested the colony, leaving a sole survivor, the young girl Newt (Carrie Henn). With the soldiers picked off one by one, a final all-female showdown brews between the alien queen and Ripley, who's become a surrogate mother to Newt. Several future stars made early career appearances in Aliens (1986), including Lance Henriksen, Bill Paxton, and Reiser(n)

programme.title: 12 Rounds
programme.desc: Cop Danny Fisher must complete 12 dangerous challenges, devised by the criminal mastermind who has kidnapped his girlfriend(n)

programme.title: The Box
programme.desc: Arthur and Norma Lewis receive a mysterious box that will grant them $1 million if they push the button inside, but they must debate if that's worth the consequence of killing a random person(n)

programme.title: Hellboy II: The Golden Army
programme.desc: Cigar-chomping demon Hellboy (Ron Perlman), the Bureau for Paranormal Research and Defense's secret weapon against things that go bump in the night, returns to battle a supernatural prince with an ancient grudge against puny humans(n)

programme.title: The Arrival
programme.desc: Astronomer Zane discovers an alien radio signal and when he tries to report it he unearths a sinister conspiracy(n)

programme.title: O
programme.desc: A contemporary retelling of Shakespeare's Othello set deep in the American South. Rising basketball star Odin, the only black student at the elite Palmetto Grove Academy, is popular with his fellow students and is also dating Desi, the beautiful daughter of the Dean. His best friend Hugo is assigned by his father, Coach Golding, to look out for Odin, due to the pressures he faces during basketball season. But Hugo, bitterly jealous of Odin's talent and good fortune, secretly seeks to destroy his friend's life(n)

programme.title: Emelie
programme.desc: Two suburban parents hire a new babysitter to look after their three kids while they enjoy a night out, but the sitter eventually reveals herself to be an unhinged imposter who has sinister designs on the family's youngest child(n)

programme.title: Our Brand Is Crisis
programme.desc: This satirical comedy starring Sandra Bullock as a political consultant gives viewers an inside look at the high-stakes, win-at-all-costs world of politics. Bullock stars as "Calamity" Jane Bodine, who is hired to work on the campaign of a Bolivian presidential candidate who has fallen behind in the polls. She faces off against her rival Pat Candy (Billy Bob Thornton), who is working on the opponent's campaign and is also looking for every opportunity to antagonize Jane. The film is loosely based on the 2005 documentary of the same name by Rachel Boynton. Directed by David Gordon Green (Pineapple Express, George Washington). Produced by Oscar-winners George Clooney and Grant Heslov(n)

programme.title: Steve Jobs
programme.desc: This biographical drama explores the genius and shortcomings of computing guru Steve Jobs through the lens of three product launches(n)

programme.title: Cocktail
programme.desc: In this tasty romantic drama, a cocky skirt-chasing bartender drops out of law school in search of a top-shelf lifestyle. Later, his romance with a pretty waitress is threatened by an alluring fashion executive who wants him all to herself(n)

programme.title: The Jewel of the Nile
programme.desc: A new chapter of adventures with Kathleen Turner and Michael Douglas in the sequel to "Romancing the Stone"(n)

programme.title: Coyote Ugly
programme.desc: Romantic comedy in which a shy songwriter moves to New York and finds love and the stardom she is seeking while working in the wild nightspot Coyote Ugly. As she attempts to get her music career off the ground, she works as a bartender, but the raucous behaviour of her colleagues - who dance on the counter while flirting outrageously with the clientele and downing copious amounts of alcohol - soon puts her relationship at risk(n)

programme.title: Cursed
programme.desc: Following a werewolf attack, nerdy siblings Ellie and Jimmy enjoy the benefits of animal magnetism. It's fun for a while, but too many people are dying and time is running out for them to find the original beast, kill it and break the curse(n)

programme.desc: Bender's Big Score. Set in the year 3000, the series follows Fry, a 25- year-old New York pizza delivery boy who, after being accidentally cryogenically frozen, wakes up to a whole new world. The future he discovers has airborne freeways, rocket ships, talking heads in jars, dangerously addictive soft drinks and Stop 'n' Drop suicide booths. Fortunately he has on hand his friends Bender a hard-drinking, cigar-smoking, pornography-reading robot, and Leela, a beautiful, one-eyed alien martial arts expert, to help him make sense of this new environment(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: In an episode originally shown in 2011, Jeremy Clarkson celebrates the 50th anniversary of the Jaguar E-type by driving a modern-day interpretation of the classic sports car, and throws a typically low-key party involving live music, fighter planes and the Royal Marines. Richard Hammond is in South Africa, where he tests the Marauder, a bigger, more rugged alternative to the Humvee, and James May enlists the help of 2010 Winter Olympic skeleton gold medallist Amy Williams and former Intercontinental Rally Challenge champion Kris Meeke to try out a Mini rally car. Plus, the Stig takes the BMW 1 Series M Coupe around the test track and Alice Cooper gets behind the wheel of the Reasonably Priced Car.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May embark on a race from London's Wembley Stadium to Milan's San Siro, the home of Italian football giants AC and Inter. A price restriction leads Jeremy to grab the keys to a Shelby Mustang GT500, which costs the equivalent of £35,000 in America and packs a supercharged punch of more than 650bhp. James and Richard pin their hopes on the pan-European rail network in a bid to secure the prize of tickets to a top-flight football match, with nothing but a long journey home awaiting the losers. On the test track, Jeremy puts Toyota's GT86 coupe through its paces, and its promise of entertaining rear-wheel-drive handling should put a smile on his face. Plus, singer-songwriter Amy Macdonald gets to grips with the Reasonably Priced Car.(n)

programme.sub-title: Welcome to America's Most Haunted Town

programme.title: Ghosts of Shepherdstown
programme.desc: Do You Know You're Dead?. A female college student claims to have had a run-in with what she believes to be a young spirit that has haunted her campus for decades. After an alleged violent confrontation, the team must perform an emergency intervention before things get deadly(n)

programme.title: Ghosts of Shepherdstown
programme.desc: She Didn't Have a Face. The sighting of a headless woman on a porch is investigated by Nick, Elizabeth and Bill, who come to suspect that there is more than a single entity haunting this house(n)

programme.title: Ghosts of Shepherdstown
programme.desc: Grave Stalker. The team rush to the aid of a woman who heard a phantom gunshot in the center of town and is convinced she's being stalked by an angry spirit. Their investigation uncovers a surprising connection to a grisly murder that occurred in the 1890s(n)

programme.title: Ghosts of Shepherdstown
programme.desc: It's Behind You. A woman sees a phantom corpse in the Potomac River, which leads to the discovery of a murder in the town woods, where evidence of satanic rituals is found and a dark presence that puts Bill at risk is encountered(n)

programme.title: Ghosts of Shepherdstown

programme.title: Ghosts of Shepherdstown

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Suspicion falls on the father of a four-year-old boy who goes missing from his garden, but CCTV footage of the abduction tells a different story. Callum, visiting Sun Hill to discuss his suspension, follows the unfolding case and cannot resist chipping in with his opinion of the suspect, but it is solid work by his colleagues in the uniform branch that finally tracks the missing child to a storm drain beside the Thames, where rapidly rising water puts several lives in danger. Joel Beckett guest stars.(n)

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Jack directs an operation to keep rival football fans apart, but ends up unwittingly channelling a group of them into a dangerous situation. As tension mounts, Commander Lisa Kennedy becomes increasingly anxious about her son, who is attending the match, and she takes control when an ambulance is needed to reach a woman suffering an asthma attack in the crowd. In the ensuing clean-up, a body is discovered.(n)

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. Commander Kennedy prepares to face a hostile media over charges that police handling of the football crowd contributed to the murder, and is shocked to see CCTV footage showing her own son running away from the crime scene. The victim turns out to have a complicated love life that may have led to the killing, and two other suspects are identified, but the commander's leadership and probity face their sternest test.(n)

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: An old friend of Mickey's is knocked off his bike and killed, and the victim's brother - a known drug dealer - approaches the detective with a request to investigate whether it was a case of murder. Max persuades Neil to let them pursue the inquiry and shows his commitment to the undercover operation by snorting cocaine with their chief suspect.(n)

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Sister Julienne receives an SOS from Holloway Prison, whose usual maternity workers have been struck down by illness, and when she and Trixie step in to help, the nun puts her reputation on the line to prevent a heavily pregnant convict having her unborn baby taken away by social services. Shelagh faces heartache when a routine pregnancy check reveals something far more serious, Alec has a confession for Jenny, and Fred takes the gang to the theatre to celebrate Chummy's birthday - only for the trip to end in disaster. Lacey Turner, best known as EastEnders' Stacey Branning, guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Jenny has an eventful few days, starting with a patient who as well as having herself to worry about, is also struggling to cope with her mother, an agoraphobic who hasn't been outside for at least 12 years. On top of that, Alec asks the midwife to accompany him to Brighton for the weekend, leaving her wondering if his intentions are strictly honourable. However, things soon take a tragic turn. Meanwhile, Shelagh joins the local choir to take her mind off her problems. Jessica Raine, Leo Staar and Laura Main star.(n)

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The nuns and midwives are busy preparing for Sister Evangelina's surprise jubilee celebrations, marking 50 years since she took her vows, but a face from the past threatens to ruin the party for the guest of honour. It's back to business when a young woman with Down's syndrome is brought in feeling unwell. To everyone's surprise, they discover she is six months pregnant, causing some of them to think the worst, and the staff are joined by new nurse Patsy, whose sense of humour and no-nonsense attitude make her an instant hit.(n)

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's Colour Blind
programme.desc: Drama from the best-selling author. Set between the wars, it concerns a girl who returns to her Tyneside home newly married to her black husband, only to encounter bigotry from all sides, to say nothing of her obsessed brother's animosity. Niamh Cusack, Tony Armatrading and Dearbhla Molloy star.(n)

programme.title: The Musketeers
programme.desc: Following the tragic death of a young girl hit by the royal carriage, the Musketeers go in search of her missing friend, leading them to an enigmatic noblewoman who has a peculiar effect on Athos. Before long they find themselves having to rescue this extraordinary woman when she is condemned to death for witchcraft - and to complicate matters, the Cardinal is also in danger, forcing them to put aside their feelings of animosity to save him too. Tom Burke and Peter Capaldi star in the swashbuckling drama.(n)

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: A teenager sets out to visit her favourite pop star but never returns. Witnesses claim they saw her going into his house, but he insists the only thing that entered was a small frog. Offbeat detective drama, starring Caroline Quentin and Alan Davies.(n)

programme.title: The Doctor Blake Mysteries
programme.desc: When a young woman is shot dead at a bonfire night celebration, the police immediately arrest an aboriginal boy who was standing near her with a gun in his hand. However, Blake realises the murder is not that simple and is forced to challenge the racist bias of both the police and the whole town. Starring Craig McLachlan.(n)

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Double bill. A suspected paedophile is found dead in a playground, so inexperienced detective Rory Drennan calls in Nikki and Jack to attend. It's not long before the team links his murder to the case of a missing young girl, so the child-protection officers are also brought in - though it soon becomes apparent the youngster's social worker blames herself for the disappearance. Starring Emilia Fox, David Caves and Richard Lintern, with Claudie Blakley, Lorraine Burroughs and John Dagliesh.(n)

programme.title: Spooks
programme.desc: The team sets out to halt the progress of the Chala Cartel, a massive drug-trafficking system running from Bournemouth to Bali, after the deaths of eight Customs and Excise officers who were monitoring the criminals' activity. But when a leading British company is found to have links to the Colombians, the case takes a sinister turn as the possibility of corruption rears its ugly head. Matthew Macfadyen, Nicola Walker and Megan Dodds star.(n)

programme.title: Fallen Angel
programme.desc: Part two of three. The focus shifts to Rosie's teenage years, as she reacts badly to her father's remarriage to author Vanessa and no longer feels she is the most important person in his life. Vanessa's research into an Edwardian priest who was thrown out of the Church for his macabre practices provides fuel for Rosie's confused religious beliefs as she loses her grip on sanity. With Niamh Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Fallen Angel
programme.desc: Conclusion of the crime drama trilogy. It's 1979 and Rosie is an angelic five-year-old who forms a bond with her grandfather as her father's ambitions lead him to neglect his wife and child. However, a morbid fascination with religion is already beginning to change her and a terrible event lies ahead. Charles Dance, Sheila Hancock, Clare Holman and Peter Capaldi star.(n)

programme.desc: A man attacks the wrong person in a misjudged effort to take revenge on a boxing coach who abused him during his childhood. programme.title: India's Deadliest Snakes
programme.desc: Romulus Whitaker, a snake expert with more than 40 years of field experience, sets out to discover the truth behind a reported rise in snake-bites in India, which may have caused more human deaths than the official statistics suggest. He investigates some of the subcontinent's deadliest reptiles, including the king cobra and sawscaled viper, and explores the natural history that has led to this epidemic.(n)

programme.title: Ten Deadliest Snakes with Nigel Marven
programme.desc: Naturalist Nigel Marven examines the world's most lethal snakes, beginning with a look at a group of fearsome reptiles in Costa Rica.(n)

programme.title: Ten Deadliest Snakes with Nigel Marven
programme.desc: The naturalist continues his look at fearsome snakes during a trip to the United States.(n)

programme.title: Ten Deadliest Snakes with Nigel Marven
programme.desc: The naturalist concludes his trek in search of the world's most fearsome snakes with a trip to South Africa. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: 10 Things You Didn't Know About
programme.sub-title: 10 Things You Didn't Know About Earthquakes.
programme.desc: Iain Stewart investigates some of the world's most destructive and devastating seismic activity, examining what makes earthquakes so difficult to predict or prevent. He also reveals why these powerful forces of nature can last up to 60 times longer on the surface of the moon than on Earth.(n)

programme.title: Nuclear Meltdown
programme.desc: With unprecedented access inside both Fukushima nuclear power plants, this documentary offers a minute-by-minute account of the crisis of March 2011, which was triggered by the Tohoku earthquake. The film contemplates why one plant sustained such damage, while the other - facing nearly identical challenges - emerged relatively unscathed. Contributors include some of the workers present during the incident.(n)

programme.title: Wild Ones
programme.desc: A look at creatures that can fly, focusing on falcons, pelicans, kestrels, owls, parrots, vultures and eagles.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Atlantic: The Wildest Ocean on Earth
programme.desc: Cillian Murphy narrates a documentary examining the lives of animals and people pitting themselves against the world's wildest ocean, unveiling the natural forces that underpin life in the Atlantic, from the world's most powerful currents, ferocious hurricanes and huge chains of undersea volcanoes. The first episode looks at the influence of the Gulf Stream, with whales, giant turtles and jellyfish riding the huge current that becomes a migration super-highway and helps warm northern Europe, while fishermen battle for survival in mountainous seas as they try to exploit its natural fertility.(n)

programme.title: Planet Dinosaur
programme.desc: The documentary series focuses on the heavyweights of the dinosaur world, creatures that have only been unearthed in recent years. The 125ft-long Argentinosaurus, which roamed South America 95 million years ago, was the creature that eclipsed all others - and remains the largest dinosaur ever discovered. For years, these colossal plant-eaters were considered immune to attack from any predator - until the discovery of new giant killer the mapusaurus, whose fate was inextricably linked to the Argentinosaurus.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Fishing with Robson Green
programme.desc: The actor casts off in China, where fishing is a very important skill. At Qiandao Lake in Zhekiang, he joins 100 locals in trying to land a bighead carp and samples the revered catch. More culinary experiences await as a result of Robson's hunt for octopus, and he tries his hand at cormorant fishing - but has trouble restraining his bird's constant efforts to escape.(n)

programme.title: Life in the Undergrowth
programme.desc: The story of the invertebrates that left the sea to move on to land 400 million years ago. Since then, they have become the most successful group of animals, without which the land's ecosystem would collapse. David Attenborough examines the insects' behaviour, travelling to South Africa and Venezuela to witness the habits and routines of millipedes and centipedes.(n)

programme.title: Atlantic: The Wildest Ocean on Earth

The first episode looks at the influence of the Gulf Stream, with whales, giant turtles and jellyfish riding the huge current that becomes a migration super-highway and helps warm northern Europe, while fishermen battle for survival in mountainous seas as they try to exploit its natural fertility.(n)

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough presents an exploration of Earth's vast seas, which cover 70 per cent of the planet's surface. In the first episode, millions of squid appear off the coast of California, gannets, whale sharks and dolphins hunt migrating sardines in the Indian Ocean, and thousands of turtles make the annual pilgrimage to lay their eggs in Costa Rica.(n)

Since then, they have become the most successful group of animals, without which the land's ecosystem would collapse. David Attenborough examines the insects' behaviour, travelling to South Africa and Venezuela to witness the habits and routines of millipedes and centipedes.(n)

programme.title: Planet Dinosaur
programme.desc: The documentary series focuses on the heavyweights of the dinosaur world, creatures that have only been unearthed in recent years. The 125ft-long Argentinosaurus, which roamed South America 95 million years ago, was the creature that eclipsed all others - and remains the largest dinosaur ever discovered. For years, these colossal plant-eaters were considered immune to attack from any predator - until the discovery of new giant killer the mapusaurus, whose fate was inextricably linked to the Argentinosaurus.(n)

programme.title: Countdown to a Catastrophe
programme.desc: Documentary series exploring the interrelationships between natural disasters and whether scientists will one day be able to predict when the next one will strike. The programme begins by looking at volcanos, 1,900 of which are considered to be active.(n)

programme.title: Quarantine
programme.desc: TV reporter Angela Vidal is trapped in a building where the residents have been infected by a virus that turns them into blood-thirsty killers(n)

programme.title: Hope Floats
programme.desc: Sentimental romance about a former beauty queen who returns home to rebuild her shattered life after being publicly humiliated on a TV talk show. The woman finds her life coming apart at the seams when her best friend and lover invite her onto a chat show in order to tell her they are having an affair(n)

programme.title: The Cable Guy
programme.desc: One man wants free cable while his strangely possessive cable guy wants a new friend(n)

programme.title: Jumanji
programme.desc: Two children discover a mysterious board game in their attic. As they roll the dice, out pops crazy Alan -a man who has been trapped inside for 26 years - and a jungle-full of wild animals(n)

programme.title: Footloose
programme.desc: Chicago kid Kevin Bacon moves to a Midwest town, but finds dancing and music banned by zealous preacher John Lithgow. Foot-tapping 80s favourite of rocking and rebellion(n)

programme.title: 3:10 to Yuma
programme.desc: Desperate for money, frontier rancher Van Heflin holds outlaw Glenn Ford at gunpoint, intending to collect the $200 reward. While both men await the train to Yuma that will escort Ford to prison, the cagey outlaw offers Heflin $10,000 if he'll set Ford free. The rest of the film is a sweat-inducing cat-and-mouse game between captive and captor, interrupted with bursts of violence from both Ford's gang (commandeered by Richard Jaeckel) and the vacillating townsfolk(n)

programme.title: The Ghost and the Darkness
programme.desc: When the building of a railroad through a village in colonial Africa is halted by the sudden horrific onslaught of two man-eating lions, the project's chief engineer (Val Kilmer) calls in a big-game hunter (Michael Douglas) to bring the predators down. Tom Wilkinson, John Kani, Bernard Hill, Brian McCardie, Henry Cele, Om Puri, Emily Mortimer, Alex Ferns, Nick Lorentz, Kurt Egelhof(n)

programme.title: I Know What You Did Last Summer
programme.desc: A year after their car hit a stranger, four teenagers are being stalked by someone(n)

programme.title: The Cable Guy
programme.desc: One man wants free cable while his strangely possessive cable guy wants a new friend(n)

programme.title: Jerry Maguire
programme.desc: Tom Cruise stars as a sports agent, frustrated at dishonesty within the industry, who goes it alone with a single, unpredictable client (Cuba Gooding Jr.). Heartfelt comedy starring Rene Zellweger(n)

programme.title: Footloose
programme.desc: Chicago kid Kevin Bacon moves to a Midwest town, but finds dancing and music banned by zealous preacher John Lithgow. Foot-tapping 80s favourite of rocking and rebellion(n)

programme.title: True Lies
programme.desc: A spy who tries to keep his profession a secret from his spouse fights international bad guys while attempting to win his wife back from a salesman who is trying to steal her away(n)

programme.title: Black Sheep
programme.desc: Comedy starring the late Chris Farley as the younger brother of an aspiring politician. Mike Donnelly (Farley) is the sibling of prospective State Governor Al (Tim Matheson), whom Al knows could be something of a liability on the campaign trail. To ensure that he does not become an embarrassment, Al places the mischievous Mike in the care of one of his aides, Steve Dodds (David Spade) - a task which Dodds does not exactly relish!(n)

programme.title: Hollow Man
programme.desc: A scientist, fearing that his project will be cut by the government, takes the new vanishing chemicals himself and runs amok. The dazzling special effects earned an Oscar nomination(n)

programme.title: Deep Impact
programme.desc: Mimi Leder (The Peacemaker) directed this science-fiction disaster drama about the possible extinction of human life after a comet is discovered headed toward Earth with the collision only one year away. Ambitious MSNBC reporter Jenny Lerner (Tea Leoni) stumbles onto the story, prompting a White House press conference. United States President Beck (Morgan Freeman) announces the government's solution: a team of astronauts will travel to the comet and destroy it. The team leader aboard the spaceship Messiah is Spurgeon Tanner (Robert Duvall), who was once the last man to walk on the moon. However, the mission fails, splitting off a chunk of the comet, now due to land in the Atlantic with the impact sending a 350-foot tidal wave flooding 650 miles inland, destroying New York and other cities. The larger part of the comet, hitting in Canada, will trigger an E.L.E. (Extinction Level Event), not unlike a "nuclear winter" as dust clouds block out the sun and bring life to an end. President Beck reveals Plan B: a cavernous underground retreat constructed to hold one million Americans, with most to be selected through a national lottery. Since teenage amateur astronomer Leo Biederman (Elijah Wood) discovered the comet, his family gets a pass to enter the cave, but his girlfriend Sarah (Leelee Sobieski) and her parents will be left behind. Meanwhile, still in space, Spurgeon Tanner devises a plan for a kamikaze-styled operation that could possibly save the Earth. Special visual effects by Scott Farrar and Industrial Light & Magic(n)

programme.title: The Walk
programme.desc: In this moving drama based on a true story, tightrope walker Philippe Petit crosses back and forth between the Twin Towers in 1974. Petit works to accomplish this feat while dealing with logistical problems and the concern of his loved ones(n)

programme.title: Jerry Maguire
programme.desc: Tom Cruise stars as a sports agent, frustrated at dishonesty within the industry, who goes it alone with a single, unpredictable client (Cuba Gooding Jr.). Heartfelt comedy starring Rene Zellweger(n)

programme.title: How Stella Got Her Groove Back
programme.desc: Angela Bassett stars as a 40-year-old workaholic who vacations in Jamaica, where she becomes romantically involved with a man (Taye Diggs) half her age. But as their passion grows stronger, she worries that their unusual relationship is too complicated. Whoopi Goldberg, Regina King, Suzzanne Douglas. Based on the novel by Terry McMillan(n)

programme.title: Waiting to Exhale
programme.desc: A surprise Hollywood hit, this film is based on the novel of the same name by Terry McMillan and centers on four well-to-do African-American women and their relationships with men and one another. All of them are "holding their breath" until the day they can feel comfortable in a committed relationship with a man. Robin (Lela Rochon) is the long-time mistress of Russell (Leon), who keeps reneging on his promise to leave his wife for her. She dumps him to find a man she can have to herself, but her dates with a reliable but unattractive business partner (Wendell Pierce) and a drug addict (Mykelti Williamson) send her back to Russell. Savannah (Whitney Houston) is a successful television producer who also believes that her married lover Kenneth (Dennis Haysbert) will leave his wife. Bernadine (Angela Bassett) is a wealthy woman who abandoned her own career to raise a family. Her husband is now leaving her to marry a white woman. Gloria (Loretta Devine) is a beauty salon owner and single mother raising a teenage son. After years alone, she falls in love with a new neighbor, Marvin (Gregory Hines). The women share their stories over lunches and conversations at Gloria's salon(n)

programme.title: Black Sheep
programme.desc: Comedy starring the late Chris Farley as the younger brother of an aspiring politician. Mike Donnelly (Farley) is the sibling of prospective State Governor Al (Tim Matheson), whom Al knows could be something of a liability on the campaign trail. To ensure that he does not become an embarrassment, Al places the mischievous Mike in the care of one of his aides, Steve Dodds (David Spade) - a task which Dodds does not exactly relish!(n)

programme.title: The Shallows
programme.desc: A young surfer is hunted by a great white shark at a secluded beach, and ends up stranded on an embankment away from the shoreline. Alone and wounded, she attempts to survive the attack and get ashore(n)

programme.title: Private Parts
programme.desc: When Cheryl and her roommate quarrel, Cheryl moves into her aunt's hotel in downtown L.A. rather than return home to Ohio. She wants to be treated like a woman, and she's drawn to George, a handsome photographer who lives in the hotel(n)

programme.title: Meet Wally Sparks
programme.desc: Disgustingly obnoxious talk-show host Wally Sparks - amid pressure from his host network to clean up his act - becomes embroiled in a scandal involving doctored photos of a Southern governor in a rather compromising situation. Rodney Dangerfield, Debi Mazar, Cindy Williams, Burt Reynolds, David Ogden Stiers, Alan Rachins(n)

programme.title: Empire State
programme.desc: A security guard and his best friend scheme to rob an armoured-car company, but a determined cop is hot on their tail(n)

programme.title: Played
programme.desc: After taking the fall for a heist gone wrong, a thief (Mick Rossi) gets out of prison and returns to the streets of London looking to settle the score. Val Kilmer and Gabriel Byrne costar in this gritty and action-packed crime thriller. Vinnie Jones, Patrick Bergin. Directed by Sean Stanek(n)

programme.title: The A-Team
programme.desc: A Nice Place to Visit. A murderous family is holding an entire town in thrall. George Peppard, Mr. T, Dirk Benedict, Dwight Schultz, Melinda Culea. Trish: Joanna Kerns. Sheriff: Burton Gilliam. Deke: Don Stroud. Dan: Sandy Ward(n)

programme.title: Little Odessa
programme.desc: A somber portrait of organized crime and family trauma, Little Odessa centers on the trouble caused when hit man Joshua Shapira (Tim Roth) returns to his old neighborhood of Brighton Beach, Brooklyn. A hired killer for the Russian Mafia, Joshua is given an assignment in his hometown, where he renews contact with his younger brother Reuben (Edward Furlong) and an old flame (Moira Kelly). But others do not welcome Joshua's return, particularly his harsh, estranged father (Maximillian Schell), who had disowned Joshua years before and currently attempts to keep him from visiting his seriously ill mother (Vanessa Redgrave). The pressure of these family crises combine with Joshua's deepening involvement in the local crime scene, ultimately triggering a bloody confrontation. First-time director James Gray creates a solemn, oppressive atmosphere that emphasizes the already grim nature of his story. The slow pace and familiar crime narrative were attacked by many viewers, contributing to a mixed critical reaction, but Little Odessa nevertheless won admiration for Gray's visual sense and the skilled performance by Roth in the unsympathetic lead role(n)

programme.title: The Grudge 2
programme.desc: A young woman searches for her missing sister in Tokyo with the help of a journalist, and ends up being exposed to the same supernatural curse that afflicted her sibling in this sequel(n)

programme.title: Black Mask
programme.desc: The acrobatic martial artistry of Jet Li is on fistic display in this rough-and-tumble crime drama. Li plays a retired commando who believes his former comrades may have a hand in a bloody power struggle involving the Hong Kong drug trade. Patrick Lung Kang, Karen Mok, Anthony Wong, Lau Ching-Wan(n)

programme.title: Hot Shots! Part Deux
programme.desc: Topper Harley takes on a rescue mission for American hostages trapped in an unnamed Middle Eastern country. The men behind Airplane! take aim at Sly Stallone and the muscle-pumped heroics of Rambo in a gag-stacked spoof(n)

programme.title: 12 Rounds 3: Lockdown
programme.desc: After returning to duty, a haunted police officer finds evidence that incriminates several of his colleagues in this gritty, action-packed thriller. As a result, the corrupt cops attempt to silence him in order to save their careers(n)

programme.title: Starship Troopers
programme.desc: Ultraviolent futuristic thriller about coed infantry trainees preparing to wipe out mankind's newest enemy: giant bugs from outer space(n)

programme.title: The River Wild
programme.desc: Experienced rafter Gail is introducing her family to the river she grew up on, when two dangerous strangers throw their vacation into jeopardy. Tense drama(n)

programme.title: Kiss of the Dragon
programme.desc: Jet Li stars as top Chinese cop Liu Jian, brought to Paris to help crack a major drugs ring. But when the official with whom he's meant to liaise ends up dead, he realises that corrupt cop Jean-Pierre Richard is the head of the ring. Jian must not only prove he is innocent of the murder but also evade Richard's thugs, who want him dead. In a city where he knows nobody, Jian's only ally is a prostitute, Jessica(n)

programme.title: Commando
programme.desc: Colonel Matrix (Arnold Schwarzenegger) is retired and living peaceably with his 10-year-old daughter (Alyssa Milano) when she is kidnapped by the henchmen of an exiled Latin American dictator. The dictator's plan is to reinstate himself in power by eliminating the president of his country, using Matrix to kill him (or he will kill the kidnapped daughter). Matrix escapes from the plane that is supposed to be carrying him to his mission and then proceeds to go from one violent confrontation to the next as he hunts down the dictator and moves to rescue his daughter. Helping him is Cindy (Rae Dawn Chong), who has her own reasons for wanting the dictator dead(n)

programme.title: The A-Team
programme.desc: Recipe for Heavy Bread. Action adventure series. The team sets out to rescue an old friend - their cook when they were prisoners of war in Vietnam - who is about to be assassinated by dope smugglers(n)

programme.title: Lonesome Dove Church
programme.desc: A pastor must rescue his estranged son, who is wanted for murder and on the run from a posse. They eventually end up in a small town in Texas, where they found a famous church(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team uncovers a fraudulent charity that preys on those searching for missing military personnel while investigating the murder of a retired Master Sergeant. Meanwhile, Bishop agonises over the results of her probation evaluation, and Tony contemplates adopting a stray cat that followed him home. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates the cause of a hit-and-run incident in which a Petty Officer has been killed. Meanwhile, Gibbs works to clear a Navy Hospital Corpsman who has been indicted for illegally providing medical aid to victims of the crash, despite the injured insisting her techniques helped save their lives. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: An enigmatic killer shoots dead a businessman spending Thanksgiving at a hotel in the city, then takes his glasses, jewellery and ID to Washington Dulles airport, which has been brought to a stand-still by a massive snowstorm. As the murderer's actions take effect, a terror alert is issued, leaving all northern US airports in a state of panic, and leaving it up to DiNozzo, Bishop and her husband - all of whom are trapped at Dulles by the weather - to bring the armed villain to justice. Crime drama, starring Michael Weatherley.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: McGee deals with his father's recent death by writing him a letter outlining the details of his latest investigation. The case involved tracking down a hactivist collective known as Krampus, who were thought to have been responsible for an incident in which the internet crashed all over Washington, DC. McGee and Abby brought in three known cyber-terrorists for questioning, and discover evidence that links the trio to an attempted breach of the Congress email server and archive. However, when this line of inquiry reaches a dead-end, the team picks up a new lead that suggests an isolated hacker from Wisconsin may be responsible. This `lone wolf' scenario does not seem plausible to McGee, though, as he recalls a lesson his late dad taught him. Crime drama, starring Sean Murray.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The bodies of five people, all of whom are identified as being from the US Navy, are found on the floor of a diner, and all are connected to a suspicious tax firm that specialises in helping people who are in arrears. When further killings are linked to the business, the team realises the crime seem to be copycats of previous cases. Meanwhile, two of Gibbs' ex-wives appear at the location with something important to discuss with the agent. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A bank employee is murdered during a robbery and the CBI attempts to track down the killer. An analysis of surveillance footage from previous heists reveals a likely suspect, but without proof the CBI is forced to let him walk - although Jane surmises that the gang must have been working with an inside man. With the FBI breathing down their necks, the team helps Jane figure out who among the witnesses may have been involved in the crime.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: The CBI team attends the scene of a murder in Carson Springs - a small town divided by two rival gangs. A blood trail next to the victim leads to another mystery when Rigsby finds his father Steve in a nearby shack with a bullet in his heart. He also seems unable, or unwilling, to talk as his son and Lisbon try unsuccessfully to get information from him. Guest starring William Forsythe (Boardwalk Empire, The Rock).(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: In the 100th episode of the crime drama, a series of flashbacks reveals how Patrick Jane came to the CBI with the hope of gaining access to the Red John case files, having lost his wife and daughter the previous year at the hands of the serial killer. After provoking an agent into attacking him, Jane threatens to sue unless he is allowed to stick around, and his first case with the bureau is to solve the murder of a judge's son, whose body was found next to his car on a remote road. Simon Baker stars.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A security guard is found murdered in an upmarket neighbourhood and the CBI agents investigate, leading them to believe a wealthy couple have been kidnapped - but events take an unexpected turn. Meanwhile, Jane continues to look into Lorelei Martins' disappearance from the Sacramento County Jail. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: The CBI team looks into the death of Cassie Flood, a journalist whose car careered off a winding mountain road. It looks like an accident at first, but Jane soon realises that foul play was involved and the investigation leads to billionaire philanthropist Tommy Volker - and Lisbon and Jane uncover evidence that Cassie was about to blow the whistle on his shady dealings. Guest starring Henry Ian Cusick (Lost).(n)

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: The wealthy parents of a murdered socialite attempt to hire Bull to help prosecute their daughter's working-class fiance for the crime, but he chooses to help the defendant instead.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A navy lieutenant is murdered during a `tiger cruise', during which sailors' friends and relatives are invited aboard military vessels to spend the night on their ship.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs sends Quinn and Bishop to Philadelphia to investigate when the murder of a petty officer is linked to the disappearance of an MI6 agent.(n)

programme.title: Shots Fired
programme.desc: Preston and Ashe find themselves under pressure to put together the pieces of the puzzle, after police find what seems to be the weapon used to kill Campbell.(n)

programme.title: Baskets
programme.desc: Martha tries her hand at being Chips' talent manager, and books him a pair of jobs. Meanwhile, Christine gets fed up with her sons.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter infuriates Lois by turning the attic into a man cave, while Brian builds a device to help Stewie conquer his terrifying nightmares.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Francine's attraction to Stan wanes after he becomes addicted to slot-car racing, and Roger becomes an air-stewardess in an attempt to secure an audience for his comedy routines.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan is horrified when Steve's friend Barry comes close to beating his high-school wrestling record, and enlists Roger's help to defeat him. However, his plan proves to be badly flawed when Roger threatens to claim the record instead.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Stewie sets off for England to take refuge in his favourite TV show, but ends up taking a detour to Saudi Arabia. Meanwhile, Lois embarrasses Peter at a concert. With the guest voices of rock band Kiss.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Stories inspired by viewers' letters, featuring a look at the world from Stewie's point of view and a British version of the Griffins. Peter also gains the power to turn everyone in Quahog into Robin Williams by touching them.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan goes out with some co-workers, but their night gets completely out of control when bodies pile up in the boot of Dick's car. Meanwhile, Roger and Hayley try to find out which of them is better looking. Animated comedy, with the voices of Seth MacFarlane and Scott Grimes.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Steve is selected to sing the national anthem at a Veterans Day celebration, but Stan is convinced he is not ready to undertake such a prestigious task, and decides he will only be capable of performing with feeling once he has experienced war first-hand.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.sub-title: When You Wish Upon a Weinstein.

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter goes on a second honeymoon with Lois in an effort to put the spark back into their marriage, and tries to get an upgrade on their hotel suite by impersonating Mel Gibson. Meanwhile, Chris gets into trouble for having alcohol at a school dance - despite protesting it was not his.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.sub-title: Fast Times at Buddy Cianci Jr High.
programme.desc: Chris falls in love with new teacher Mrs Lockhart - who takes advantage of his naive infatuation by luring him into a scheme to kill her unsuspecting husband. Meanwhile, Brian takes a job as a substitute teacher and is put in charge of a remedial class. With the guest voice of Drew Barrymore.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Mort and Quagmire both notch up notable achievements, making Peter feel he ought to do something he can be proud of. He decides to set the world record for swallowing coins - but does not take into account the dangers of nickel poisoning.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan is asked to persuade the dictator of Isla Island to sign a treaty to secure a promotion at work. However, he ends up accidentally killing the man, and enlists Roger to take his place.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: The family takes Hayley on a trip to look at colleges and leaves Steve home alone. He and his friends find what they think is a video game in Stan's study - but it turns out to be a CIA drone.(n)

programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.desc: Natalie accompanies Adrian on a nostalgic visit to the inn where he spent his honeymoon with Trudy, but their stay is interrupted by the mysterious disappearance of a garrulous fellow guest. Comedy drama, guest starring Paul Ben-Victor (The Wire).(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: With the help of cult leader Bret Stiles (recurring guest star Malcolm McDowell), Patrick orchestrates an elaborate plan to break Lorelei Martins out of prison - making it look as if she kidnapped him before going on the run. While Lisbon and Homeland Security agent Robert Kirkland attempt to rescue Patrick, he tries to earn Lorelei's trust so that he can finally catch serial killer Red John. Starring Simon Baker, who also directs this episode.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: The CBI investigates the murder of an estate agent who used to be in a gang. While his sister swears that he hasn't been involved in such activity for several years, further enquiries reveal that the leader had beat him up recently and was trying to find him on the night of the killing. Elsewhere, Jane searches for leads on his new connection to serial killer Red John.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a personal trainer who was killed in the car park of a restaurant, but the only witness is a frightened valet with OCD. Meanwhile, the department has to complete anti-terrorism training to receive funding from the government. Detective drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Tensions run high after two Latino gang members are murdered, and the department must solve the crime before the situation develops into a gang war. Brenda has a health scare when she finally visits her doctor. Detective drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda and her team face a race against time to catch a notorious serial killer, apparently striking after an absence of several years, when the bodies of two women are found bearing his grisly hallmarks. Detective drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda is removed from investigative duty by the department psychiatrist after shooting a serial killer, and tasked with accompanying a journalist on a routine patrol. They soon find themselves under sniper attack and the writer is killed. Brenda assumes she was the intended victim, but evidence mounts that this may not have been the case. Kyra Sedgwick stars in an episode directed by Kevin Bacon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: American social worker Sarah Goode is taken hostage by militants in northern Syria, and thanks to the efforts of the Navy Seals, is eventually returned home unharmed. Evidence from the incident suggests US citizen Kyle Nasry was connected to the kidnapping, but when the agents trace Nasry to a rally held by a controversial imam, they are surprised to find Sarah among the attendees. Meanwhile, DiNozzo finally takes his relationship with Zoe Keates public - surprising none of his colleagues. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs and his colleagues investigate when Eric Kutzler, the first openly gay Navy lieutenant tipped to receive the Medal of Honour, is murdered. While the agents initially suspect Kutzler's death was the result of a hate crime, the fact that his police officer husband waited 20 minutes to report the crime suggests he had something to hide. Meanwhile, the team throws a baby shower for Palmer as his wife's due date approaches. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Chris wants to start a new hobby and befriends a puppeteer named Franz, an old friend of Herbert's. Despite hearing warnings about the entertainer's past, the duo remain friends until Franz's dark history is revealed.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.sub-title: The Hand That Rocks the Wheelchair.
programme.desc: Meg offers to look after Joe while Bonnie is out of town, but her enthusiasm for the task begins to grow increasingly disturbing. Comedy, featuring the voices of Mila Kunis and Patrick Warburton.(n)

programme.title: Marvel's Agent Carter
programme.desc: Former SAS officer Peggy Carter, who fought alongside Captain America during the Second World War, finds herself consigned to a desk job as hostilities come to an end. Frustrated by the red-tape that prevents her making use of her skills as an expert spy, Peggy jumps at the chance to get back out into the field when she is approached in secret by her old friend Howard Stark - father of future Iron Man Tony Stark - who has been labelled a traitor, and seeks her help to clear his name. Espionage drama, set during the late 1940s, starring Hayley Atwell.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy

programme.title: Whacked Out Sports
programme.desc: Generally telecast on the weekend late-night schedule, the half-hour Whacked Out Sports was a reality "clip" show devoted to unusual sports activities and embarrassing bloopers. The series' specialty seemed to be spotlighting eccentric contestants indulging in offbeat sports events with bizarre rules. In each market that the series played, viewers were invited to send in video clips of "crazy stuff never seen on TV" -- especially if "hot girls" were involved (that's what it said on the press release!). Seen on the NBC-owned stations in the larger markets, Whacked Out Sports was initially broadcast on September 7, 2006(n)

programme.title: White House Down
programme.desc: A devoted father fights a ruthless paramilitary group that has seized control the White House in this high-stakes action thriller from director Roland Emmerich (2012) and writer James Vanderbilt (The Amazing Spider-Man). Dejected after being turned down for a position with the Secret Service but unable to break the news to his adoring daughter, Capitol policeman John Cale (Channing Tatum) is taking her on a tour of the White House when a powerful explosion rips through the building, sparking mass chaos. When the smoke clears, Cale learns that heavily armed rebels have taken both his daughter (Joey King) and the president (Jamie Foxx) hostage. As news of the attack creates mass panic and fear of total collapse, Cale realizes that the fate of his daughter, the Commander in Chief, and the entire nation rest in his willingness to fight back against the terrorists who have brought the most powerful nation on the planet to its knees. Maggie Gyllenhaal, Jason Clarke, Richard Jenkins, and James Woods co-star(n)

programme.title: Zero Dark Thirty
programme.desc: Kathryn Bigelow and Mark Boal, the Academy Award-winning duo behind The Hurt Locker, reteam for this drama detailing the hunt for Osama bin Laden, which stars Oscar nominee Jessica Chastain as the intelligence expert who dedicated a decade of her life to tracking down the world's most wanted terrorist. In the aftermath of the 9/11 terrorist attacks, the CIA began interrogating suspected Al Qaeda agents across the globe in a bid to locate the elusive bin Laden. Upon arriving at a CIA black site and witnessing the brutal interrogation tactics firsthand, driven operative Maya (Chastain) aids her unpredictable colleague Dan (Jason Clarke) in gathering the intelligence that will help bring their target to justice. Over the course of the next decade, numerous false leads and dead ends make the search seem more futile than ever. Meanwhile, numerous suicide bombings across the Middle East and Europe hint that Al Qaeda won't go down without a fight. Then, just when it seems as if the trail of clues has finally dried up, an old piece of evidence leads Maya to a suspect who may work directly for the man charged with planning the worst act of terrorism ever committed on American soil. Joel Edgerton, Edgar Ramirez, Mark Strong, Chris Pratt, and James Gandolfini co-star(n)

programme.title: Rise of the Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: Created in a San Francisco lab by an ambitious father-and-son scientist team seeking to cure Alzheimer's disease, genetically engineered chimp Caesar (Andy Serkis) uses his powerful intellect to lead an ape uprising in this thrilling sci-fi prequel(n)

programme.title: Dawn of the Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: A war begins to brew between man and ape in this sequel to the 2011 hit Rise of the Planet of the Apes. It's been ten years since the Simian Flu wiped out most of humanity, and somewhere deep in the woods outside of San Francisco, Caesar (voice and performance capture by Andy Serkis) and his primate companions have established a thriving village built on the principles of peace and community. Shortly after welcoming a baby brother into the family, Caesar's son Blue Eyes (Nick Thurston) is walking through the forest with his friend Ash (Doc Shaw) when they cross paths with a human named Carver (Kirk Acevedo), who impulsively draws his gun and shoots Ash at the first sign of aggression. As it turns out, Carver is part of a human expedition led by Malcolm (Jason Clarke), who, along with the rest of his crew, races to Carver's side just as Caesar and the rest of the apes answer Blue Eyes' desperate call for help. An enraged Caesar drives the humans away after realizing they are no longer a threat, and decides to dispatch a small crew to follow them rather than yield to the pleas of his aggressive advisor Koba (Toby Kebbell) to launch an all-out attack. Instead, he decides to show the apes' strength by amassing outside of the humans' makeshift community at the base of an unfinished tower, making it unmistakably clear that the two species should remain apart. Meanwhile, the point of the human excursion was to get a dormant dam running again in order to power their community, which will soon be thrust into darkness should they fail to take action. Convinced that he could strike a truce with Caesar that would allow the humans to repair the dam, which is located on the apes' land, Malcolm gets permission from human leader Dreyfus (Gary Oldman) to set out on his mission. Incredibly, thanks to the help of his girlfriend Ellie (Keri Russell), his son Alexander (Kodi Smit-McPhee), and a few other key allies, Malcolm succeeds. Still, his truce with the apes is a fragile one, and just when it seems that the primates and humans have learned to coexist in peace, a shocking act of betrayal threatens to spark a war that will determine the dominant species(n)

She fell in love with her saviour, but the disaster on the horizon meant their time together was doomed to be short. programme.desc: Ree Drummond prepares a prairie picnic for friends, with chicken Milanese Mediterranean orzo salad, cold roasted veggies with herby yogurt dip, and pina colada tres leches cakes.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond makes homemade takeout for lunch, with Tex-Mex fried rice and salad. For dinner, she prepares smothered pork chops with smashed red potatoes and sliced tomatoes.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver joins a partridge shoot, finding out from a gamekeeper how to get involved with the countryside. He then rustles up dishes using fresh game birds and recipes inspired by Asian, European and traditional British cuisine, designed to get the best flavour possible.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef looks for things to do with pumpkins other than turning them into traditional Halloween lanterns. Recipes include a roast duck and pumpkin winter salad with Asian dressing, a soup and a lighter snack - squash fairy cakes.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef serves up home-grown winter salad dishes, including a bagna cauda, a herb omelette, and a Japanese-style tuna sashimi with sprouting herb salad and a surprising dressing. Meanwhile, gardener Brian experiments with seeds to demonstrate the full array of colourful, tasty ingredients available in the cold, dark months.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver rustles up more simple dishes using home-grown produce. He is joined by a Welsh sheep farmer who tackles common misconceptions about lamb and explains how the conditions the animals are kept in affects the quality of the meat.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares recipes using leeks, including pappardelle and a `concertina' squid dish. He also explains why the underrated vegetables can be a real asset in the kitchen and offers advice on how to grow and store them.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Ministry of Food
programme.desc: With his campaign drawing to a close, Jamie Oliver is unsure the lessons he has taught to the people of Rotherham will stick after his departure. With this in mind, he approaches the local council in the hope that it will encourage the population to continue living healthily. He also organises a series of Pass It On street parties, culminating in a bash for the entire town. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits a Mexican restaurant in Chesterfield that serves pork chilli verde, and a lobster shack in Boston that makes lobster macaroni cheese.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri travels to St Louis to visit a New Orleans roadhouse serving rice and beans, cajun pot-stickers and pulled pork pasta.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits a traditional pasta institution in Syracuse making a tomato sauce just for dipping, and spicy chicken, duck and cheese pizza.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits a basement restaurant in Syracuse, New York serving waffles with their fried chicken, and a full Thanksgiving dinner.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits a barbecue joint in Brooklyn, New York, that mashes up a variety of styles for their wings and beef ribs.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits a 60-year-old drive-in restaurant in San Antonio, Texas, where the owners are putting a Thai twist on classic Texas barbecue.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits an Italian joint serving fried chicken, arancini balls and a decadent sacred swine sandwich.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy visits an underground joint in Syracuse, New York, serving up chicken caesar sandwiches and spicy, sweet sausage fajitas.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy visits Southern-inspired Brooklyn, New York, to sample fried chicken and waffles, a spicy pulled pork sandwich and a daily doughnut.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri feasts on the tastes of Europe, in Tacoma he visits an Eastern European restaurant serving a hangover soup and a meat dish.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Sampling food straight of the grill, beginning in Los Angeles where he samples a hot pork sandwich and a Mediterranean lamb burger.(n)

programme.title: Chopped Junior
programme.desc: The young chefs have a chance to get messy with sloppy joes in round one, while a red pesto and some white turnips keep things interesting in the entree round.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Ministry of Food
programme.desc: With his campaign drawing to a close, Jamie Oliver is unsure the lessons he has taught to the people of Rotherham will stick after his departure. With this in mind, he approaches the local council in the hope that it will encourage the population to continue living healthily. He also organises a series of Pass It On street parties, culminating in a bash for the entire town. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: The owner of a Moroccan-themed restaurant in California asks for help as he believes his manager might have a gambling problem.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: The owner of Pina Pizza House in Downey, California believes his college-enrolled waiter may not have his best interests at heart.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.desc: Willie Degel helps some restaurant owners in Las Vegas who are running an eatery inside an art gallery, who are having trouble running their business.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.desc: Willie Degel helps struggling owner and chef Mike, of Trends Restaurants in Staten Island which is currently at the mercy of his out-of-control staff.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri finds a Mexican restaurant-market combo dishing out tasty tacos al pastor and carnitas tamales in Minnesota, and in Denver, he enjoys a unique dessert specialty.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri heads to Massachusetts, where he tastes pickle chips and a scone sandwich. Plus, in Colorado, an NFL pro and Triple-D alum team have green chilli and mile-high burgers.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits Minneapolis, where a gastropub is serving sandwiches piled with steak and braised beef, and Atlanta, where a Jewish deli sells a fish specialty and pastrami hash.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri samples beef empanadas and a veggie tart speciality at an Argentinian joint in Denver, and eats a Tex-Mex breakfast at a homestyle spot in Massachusetts.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: On this trip, Guy Fieri visits Atlanta, Minneapolis and Massachusetts to find food that does not require a knife and fork.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri is living it up in London and digging into a real-deal regional feast.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten prepares raspberry shortcakes.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: Ina Garten prepares a roast beef and horseradish sandwich for lunch.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: Ina Garten helps a bride-to be who is having problems planning her rehearsal dinner. She prepares two desserts while Miguel Flores-Vianna designs two table settings.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: Running a store isn't easy, and Ina should know - she ran a deli for 20 years. Ina suggests a French-inspired menu of Provencal soup, seafood and coconut madeleines for dessert as a staff thank you.(n)

programme.title: Anna Olson: Fresh
programme.desc: The cook prepares brunch, including fruit and nut muesli, eggs Benedict with peameal on scallion, waffles with tomato cream, summer sunshine smoothies, and a moist date raisin loaf.(n)

programme.title: Anna Olson: Fresh
programme.desc: Anna prepares miso grilled aubergine with scallops, grilled halibut with tomato vinaigrette, herb grilled corn on the cob, and chocolate hazelnut cheesecake.(n)

programme.title: The Healthy Gourmet
programme.desc: Hair stylist Remo Bot loves to cook like his Mama did, which unfortunately is 75 years out of date.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond's raids the pantry, and makes a fragrant chickpea curry with rice, then for sweet treats in a hurry, no-bake peanut butter bars save the day.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond's father-in-law, Chuck, is spearheading a big fence fixing project on the ranch, so Ree is saying thank you by delivering him and his crew a Tex-Mex lunch.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond's cooks hearty breakfast biscuits that her husband and son are coming to collect on their way to feed the cattle.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond is sharing four vibrant recipes to celebrate the colours of summer.(n)

programme.title: Real Girl's Kitchen
programme.desc: Haylie prepares brie with thyme and maple syrup, creamy short ribs and wild mushroom stew, as she gets ready to go camping in style.(n)

programme.title: Real Girl's Kitchen
programme.desc: The manager of Pearl's Restaurant on the Sunset strip asks Haylie to test some recipes for an after-dark crowd, so she makes Cubano sandwich and bacon-wrapped dates.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver prepares simple recipes using tomatoes and demonstrates how even the tiniest balcony or backyard can be used to grow fruit and vegetables. He also creates an oven-baked sausage ragu and seasonal salad, before mixing up a pale pink tomato and vodka consomme.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver creates a selection of dishes with the bumper crop of courgettes he has grown in his garden, including a salad and a recipe that involves deep-frying and stuffing the edible flowers. He also shows how the vegetable can be served as an accompaniment to grilled mackerel.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Newcomers to the competition Stevie McLaughlin, Jacqueline O'Donnell and Neil Rankin compete to represent Scotland at the banquet marking the 70th anniversary of the Normandy landings, beginning by preparing their starters. They must impress a mystery Great British Menu veteran if they are to cook for judges Prue Leith, Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort and D-Day veteran Jim Radford.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: In the second Scotland heat, Stevie McLaughlin, Jacqueline O'Donnell and Neil Rankin prepare seafood courses, taking inspiration from their families' and communities' contributions to the war effort. The contenders are vying to win a place in the regional final to get the chance to cook at a banquet marking the 70th anniversary of D-Day.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond prepares food with herbs, including lemon-rosemary scones, French onion soup with fresh thyme, a panzanella salad with basil, and a minty raita with salted naan wedges.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond prepares a prairie picnic for friends, with chicken Milanese Mediterranean orzo salad, cold roasted veggies with herby yogurt dip, and pina colada tres leches cakes.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Cake Wars
programme.desc: Four bakers compete against each other as they create Alice in Wonderland cakes for the 65th anniversary party in honour of the classic animated film.(n)

programme.title: Chopped Junior
programme.desc: The young chefs find odd gifts from the sea in the appetiser basket, and are also challenged to make chocolate ravioli desserts in a hectic final round.(n)

programme.title: Man Finds Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman travels across America on a mission to highlight some of the nation's culinary treasures. He begins in Austin, Texas, where he uncovers sought-after and top-secret restaurants and dishes.(n)

programme.title: Man Finds Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman travels to Boston, where he sheds light on some lesser-known dishes and secret restaurants in a town well known for its food.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver provides tips on hosting a barbecue and demonstrates simple rules that guarantee properly cooked food every time. He also shows the best ways to cook everything on the grill, including chicken, ribs and shellfish, before revealing his recipe for the perfect marinade.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver cooks three dishes to show the versatility of beans, using legumes he picked from his garden - home-made baked borlotti beans, a hearty runner bean stew and a marinated French bean salad.(n)

programme.title: Man Fire Food
programme.desc: Roger Mooking visits a roadside eatery in Guilford, Connecticut, an outdoor grill fuelled by slabs of local wood.(n)

programme.title: Man Fire Food
programme.desc: Mark Skudlarek fires his three-chamber kiln at Cambridge Pottery and borrows some of the kiln's coals for an outdoor wood-fired oven to cook a celebratory feast.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's American Road Trip
programme.desc: Hoping to encounter the cowboys he admired as a child, Jamie Oliver heads for Cody in Wyoming, where he samples one of the staples of a cattleman's diet - pitchfork fondue. The chef also gets the chance to ride a bucking bronco on rodeo night and meets rancher Hip Tillet, who teaches him how to prepare local speciality Rocky Mountain oysters.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.desc: Willie meets Alan, who thought he could spend more time with his loved ones if he staffed his restaurant with his relatives - only to discover business and family do not always mix.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: Andy, owner of 55 Degree Wine and Link-n-Hops in Los Angeles, believes discrepancies at both his wine shop and restaurant are somehow related. Charles Stiles sends in Mystery Diners Destiney and Rob to investigate.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: Fearing that a member of staff is using restaurant supplies to operate a competing catering company, Lenny, owner of Cookin' with Lenny Smokehouse, Los Angeles, asks for help.(n)

programme.sub-title: Who's That with Barry and Glenda?.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg, Truly and Alvin take a group of pensioners to a farm for the day, but their act of charity backfires when it becomes clear the elderly daytrippers are not happy with the idea.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Barry Becomes a Psychopathic Killer but Only Part-Time.
programme.desc: Smiler finds himself pursued by a wanton gold-digger who thinks he's rich, but luckily Truly is full of ideas to solve the problem. Stephen Lewis and Frank Thornton star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Things to Do When Your Wife Runs Off with a Turkish Waiter.
programme.desc: Barry and Glenda get a shock when a man they foolishly exchanged addresses with on holiday turns up on their doorstep. To make a strained situation worse, it appears their guest has an unusual hobby.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Always one to jump on the latest passing bandwagon, Del-Boy goes eco-friendly and decides to create a better world for baby Damien and his generation - by starting his own bottled water business. Starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst, Buster Merryfield and Tessa Peake-Jones. Christmas special from 1992.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney dates an artist who turns out to be the daughter of the Duke of Maylebury. Del sees the chance for the Trotter family to marry into the aristocracy, and disastrously gatecrashes a party at the Duke's country estate. Christmas special from 1986, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: The Trotter brothers are guests at a wedding, where they are intrigued to hear their dear departed mother inherited the ill-gotten gains of an East End bank robber - but nobody has ever found the loot. Christmas special of the long-running comedy, originally shown in 1987, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield, with a guest appearance by Joan Sims.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del pays a stripper to attend a party at the Nag's Head with Rodney, who has been bet by Mickey Pearce that he cannot find a date for the occasion. Comedy, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del-Boy enters the import trade after striking a deal with Boycie to fetch a consignment of dodgy diamonds across from Holland, and ropes in Rodney and Uncle Albert to help. Feature-length episode of the comedy, guest starring Jim Broadbent, with David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)
