programme.desc: The host profiles a selection of rock stars who, like himself, applied their creative energies to acting, charity singles and protest songs. Plus, former Top of the Pops presenter Noel Edmonds reveals how Russians tried to take down the aircraft carrying Phil Collins from Wembley to Philadelphia during Live Aid in 1985. Spoof rock documentary, starring Simon Day.(n)

programme.title: Brian Pern
programme.sub-title: The Life of Rock with Brian Pern: Death of Rock.
programme.desc: The host concludes his guide with a look at the various causes of band splits, including drink, drugs and `creative differences'. He also profiles a selection of rock stars who are focused on saving the world, and examines the state of contemporary music. Spoof rock documentary, starring Simon Day and featuring cameo performances by John Humphrys and Peter Gabriel.(n)

Henrik Stenson got his first major victory in this event last year at Royal Troon, shooting a record 20-under par to defeat Phil Mickelson by three shots. The third-place finisher, J.B. Holmes, was six-under par(n)

programme.title: Golf Central
programme.desc: Golf Central is the place to go to for up to date and comprehensive coverage from around the world of golf. Get expert insight and analysis, scores and highlights(n)

programme.title: The Golf Fix
programme.desc: A recap of The Open by teaching how to execute the best shots from Royal Birkdale and how to swing like the Champion Golfer of the Year; and a look at mental toughness as a deciding factor in the major. Also: a lesson for junior golfers, plus breakthrough technology on how to grip the golf club(n)

programme.title: Summer of '76: The Open at Royal Birkdale
programme.desc: In the Summer of '76, the Golden Boy, Johnny Miller, is poised to rival the Golden Bear, Jack Nicklaus. But on the baked-out links of Royal Birkdale, a new threat emerges at The Open—19-year-old Seve Ballesteros, who doesn't just challenge Miller in the sweltering heat off England's Northwest Coast that week, he changes the game forever. Lead by the daring Spaniard, Europe at last begins to push back in the face of American dominance(n)

programme.title: Feherty
programme.sub-title: 100th Episode Lee Trevino, John Daly and Gary McCord
programme.desc: 100th Episode Lee Trevino, John Daly and Gary McCord. Celebrating the 100th episode with guests Lee Trevino, John Daly and Gary McCord(n)

programme.title: Feherty
programme.sub-title: 100th Episode Lee Trevino, John Daly and Gary McCord
programme.desc: 100th Episode Lee Trevino, John Daly and Gary McCord. Celebrating the 100th episode with guests Lee Trevino, John Daly and Gary McCord(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Mediterranean Escapes
programme.desc: The chef is invited to a family feast in Corfu and learns how to make authentic Greek food in restaurant kitchens around the island. Later, Rick heads for familiar surroundings in Majorca, where he worked as a teenage cook, and finds out what British tourists like to eat.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Mediterranean Escapes
programme.desc: The chef continues to explore his favourite locations in the Mediterranean, visiting Majorca to sample succulent roast lamb and seafood dishes. In Barcelona, he explores the city's famous Boqueria market and finds out about Catalan cuisine.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Mediterranean Escapes
programme.desc: The chef's final trip takes him to Morocco, where he samples the delights of couscous, tagines and mint tea in the country's bazaars, before travelling along the old silk route in south-eastern Turkey to taste kebabs, another of the Mediterranean's favourite foods.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.sub-title: The View from River Cottage: Thrift and Graft.
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall shares tips on the art of recycling, demonstrating how he converted cow stalls into a highly productive vegetable garden. He also makes a traditional cold smoker from a used cider barrel, together with odds and ends found lying around the yard.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.sub-title: The View from River Cottage: Going Local.
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall looks back on his determination to use only local produce, showing how the feel-good factor makes the taste so special. His mission leads to all manner of escapades, from plundering the sea for whelks to recruiting a biker to help get fresh asparagus on to diners' plates.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.sub-title: The View from River Cottage: The Wild Harvest.
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall looks back at the role of wild food in his self-sufficiency experiment. From the outset, the hedgerow larder provided a regular supply of free ingredients for his kitchen, with a selection of leafy spring greens and autumn fungi keeping him in touch with the rhythms of the seasons.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.sub-title: The View from River Cottage: One for the Pot.
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall looks back on his experience of bagging `one for the pot', offering a reminder that all meat comes from animals. He turns the rabbits eating his lettuces into bunny burgers, for the local farmers' market and spit-roasts a roe deer for a wedding feast.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.sub-title: The View from River Cottage: Feasts and Fun.
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall revisits some of his finest food gatherings, including a blossom party picnic and a cider knees-up. He also reflects on how the sharing of locally grown, seasonal produce with others is a fundamental aspect of the River Cottage experience.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.sub-title: The View from River Cottage: Growing Your Own.
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall looks back at his time in Dorset, which began modestly and developed into a major quest for self-sufficiency. He offers tips on the six main ingredients for leading the simple life, beginning by stressing the importance of fresh-killed meat and home-grown fruit and vegetables.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: First of a two-part special in which Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall heads north in search of culinary inspiration. His journey starts in Dumfriesshire, where he learns how to make haggis, before shooting his first teal in Cumbria. In return for a tepee pitch in the Lake District, he rustles up a feast of lakeside ingredients, including the local fish char for the revellers of the Coniston Water Festival.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall concludes his trip by heading to the Lake District and Yorkshire in search of the finest northern tea experience. On his return to Dorset, he stops off in Birmingham, where he looks for the definitive recipe for curried goat. Back at base, he rustles up a Caribbean-flavoured feast for local lifeboat men, including salted pollock, rum cake and a beach bar of tropical drinks.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall celebrates the best food that the UK has to offer. He rustles up an impressive range of dishes, using the finest seasonal produce.(n)

programme.title: Eat Well for Less
programme.desc: MasterChef judge Gregg Wallace and greengrocer Chris Bavin set out to help the Scott-Dent family in Newport with their food shopping, showing them simple and effective ways to save money. Kate and Chris have three children under 10, they both work, and Kate hates cooking, so relies on freezer food, Gregg and Chris secretly watch them on a weekly shop to see where they are going wrong, and their mistakes include buying sliced and grated cheese, pre-prepared fruit and veg, and overpriced frozen food. The couple are shocked when they are told that they are spending twice the amount of an average family of five. Plus, Chris tries to allay Kate's fear of using food near its sell-by date, and investigates how safe our food labels really are, while dietician Lucy Jones investigates the nutritional differences between margarine and butter.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Eight weeks ago, the distinctive husky tones of India Fisher marked the start of another series of MasterChef. Since then, 57 of the original 60 amateur cooks have fallen by the wayside, leaving tonight's trio battling it out to succeed last year's victor Natalie Coleman as champion. All that stands between them and the title are three courses of perfect grub, so they'll be pulling out all the stops to impress judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace with spicy starters, mouth-watering mains and delicious desserts.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers: Mums Know Best
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers visit three mothers who present dishes evoking the taste of home, beginning with Welsh classics, bara brith and Welsh cakes. They sample recipes from Holland in the form of pea and ham soup and deep-fried meaty kroketten, followed by traditional Jamaican dishes, including ackee and saltfish. The duo also rustle up spaghetti Bolognese and Battenberg cake.(n)

programme.title: Nigel Slater's Simple Suppers
programme.desc: The food writer balances a selection of indulgent recipes, including chocolate cookies and duck with honey and figs, with healthy dishes prepared with fresh herbs, tomatoes and greens. He then heads to Devon, where he uses the Barber family's fruit cage to create a healthy dessert.(n)

programme.title: Luke Nguyen's Street Food Asia
programme.desc: Part two of two. Luke continues unearthing different street foods in Kuala Lumpur, starting at the central Jalan Imbi market and sampling pork bone soup.(n)

programme.title: John Torode's Korean Food Tour
programme.desc: The chef returns to Seoul in time for Chuseok, the three-day harvest festival. He also learns about Buddhist cuisine and makes Korean glass noodles.(n)

programme.title: Intervention

programme.title: Vice
programme.desc: A World in Disarray. An examination of the past, present and future of U.S. foreign policy and how post-Cold War alliances have shifted features conversations with diplomats, politicians and scholars, including Council on Foreign Relations president Richard Haass; former secretary of state Condoleezza Rice; former British prime minister Tony Blair; former UN ambassador Samantha Power; political scientist Francis Fukayama; and Sen. Chris Murphy (D-Conn.)(n)

programme.title: Good Will Hunting
programme.desc: The plot revolves around Will Hunting, who is a janitor at M.I.T. and has a unique gift for mathematics. But irresponsibility and carefree attitude becomes a hindrance towards his progress for which he requires help from a psychologist to find direction in his life(n)

programme.title: Lara Croft: Tomb Raider
programme.desc: Action tale adapted from the popular video game in which the eponymous heroine races against time to find an ancient relic before it falls into the wrong hands. The buxom adventurer travels to some exotic locales, where she battles a variety of fantastical creatures with the knowledge that the fate of mankind rests in her hands(n)

programme.title: Pearl Harbor
programme.desc: News of the death of air ace Rafe reaches his sweetheart, who starts to fall for his best pal. Rafe shows up alive in Hawaii, but the trio's problems look miniscule in comparison to the devastation wreaked by the Japanese on Pearl Harbor. Romance set against a blockbuster backdrop with the biggest budget ever footed by a single studio(n)

programme.title: Independence Day: Resurgence
programme.desc: Roland Emmerich returns to the helm for this long-awaited sequel to the 1996 blockbuster Independence Day. Fearful of another attack, the nations of Earth have teamed up against their common enemy -- the extraterrestrials who brought humanity to the brink of extinction. Using recovered alien technology to bolster their defenses, the alliance braces itself for another invasion. Jeff Goldblum and Bill Pullman reprise their roles from the original film, while Liam Hemsworth, Jessie Usher, and Maika Monroe are among the new additions to the cast(n)

programme.title: Vice
programme.desc: A World in Disarray. An examination of the past, present and future of U.S. foreign policy and how post-Cold War alliances have shifted features conversations with diplomats, politicians and scholars, including Council on Foreign Relations president Richard Haass; former secretary of state Condoleezza Rice; former British prime minister Tony Blair; former UN ambassador Samantha Power; political scientist Francis Fukayama; and Sen. Chris Murphy (D-Conn.)(n)

programme.title: Miss Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children
programme.desc: In this wondrous fantasy adventure, a boy follows a series of clues that lead him to a mysterious orphanage on a remote Welsh island. There, he discovers a community of children with unusual abilities, and learns he is destined to protect them(n)

programme.desc: When a cash-strapped single mum convinces her attorney to give her a job, she stumbles across a cover-up involving contaminated water, and sets out to take on the bad guys(n)

programme.desc: A visit to a home for orphans and abandoned children in northeastern India that was founded by a former Buddhist monk, who's reminded of his own troubled childhood by an unruly new arrival(n)

programme.desc: An unhappily married woman retreats to an inn on the North Carolina coast, where she meets a doctor who's struggling with his own crisis of conscience(n)

programme.title: Real Sports With Bryant Gumbel
programme.desc: Segments include an interview with Chechen leader and MMA figure Ramzan Kadyrov; a look at global warming's effect on the Great Barrier Reef; a visit with MLB Hall of Famer Rod Carew, who underwent a heart and kidney transplant last December(n)

programme.title: Major Payne
programme.desc: Hawk-like Marine Corps officer Benson Payne (Damon Wayans) attempts to whip into shape the usual assortment of misfit JROTC kids in this minor remake of The Private War of Major Benson. Of course, both the major and his pint-sized recruits have something to teach one another. Payne teaches them the value of self-discipline and instills self-confidence in them, and the recruits teach him to stop and smell the roses (not to mention the fact that kids sometimes need coddling rather than screaming). And, of course, there is the annual JROTC statewide competition, which the kids are obligated to win before the movie can end. While there are some funny moments (the major's exhibition in full-dress whites at a school dance, for example), the script seems too color-by-numbers to be interesting to anyone other than undiscriminating younger viewers(n)

programme.title: Over Her Dead Body
programme.desc: This spirited romp is a throwback to classic screwball comedies of the 1930s and '40s. Eva Longoria Parker is a scream as a bride who suffers a fatal accident during her wedding, and later returns as a ghost to keep her husband from taking a new lover. Paul Rudd is outstanding as her husband; Lake Bell is a treat as the new woman in his life, a caterer who doubles as a psychic; and Lindsay Sloane is impressive as his kooky sister, Chloe. Written and directed by Jeff Lowell(n)

programme.title: Leatherheads
programme.desc: In 1925, an enterprising pro football player convinces America's too-good-to-be-true college football hero to play for his team and keep the league from going under(n)

programme.sub-title: U.S. Withdrawal From the Paris Agreement

programme.desc: Segments include an interview with Chechen leader and MMA figure Ramzan Kadyrov; a look at global warming's effect on the Great Barrier Reef; a visit with MLB Hall of Famer Rod Carew, who underwent a heart and kidney transplant last December(n)

programme.title: Now You See Me 2

programme.title: About a Boy
programme.desc: Adaptation of the Nick Hornby novel about the friendship that develops between a bright but awkward 12-year-old boy and a wayward thirtysomething man masquerading as a lone parent in a bid to seduce single mothers. Ironically, it is the boy who initiates the bachelor into the world of adult responsibility and meaningful relationships as the bond between them deepens(n)

programme.desc: Adaptation of the Nick Hornby novel about the friendship that develops between a bright but awkward 12-year-old boy and a wayward thirtysomething man masquerading as a lone parent in a bid to seduce single mothers. Ironically, it is the boy who initiates the bachelor into the world of adult responsibility and meaningful relationships as the bond between them deepens(n)

programme.title: The Accountant
programme.desc: A math genius works as a financial consultant for criminal organizations. While being investigated by the Treasury Department, he agrees to help an accounting clerk look into fraud at her company, but the assignment will prove far more dangerous than he could have ever anticipated(n)

programme.title: Minority Report
programme.desc: Based on a short story by the late Philip K. Dick, this science fiction-thriller reflects the writer's familiar preoccupation with themes of concealed identity and mind control. Tom Cruise stars as John Anderton, a Washington, D.C. detective in the year 2054. Anderton works for "Precrime," a special unit of the police department that arrests murderers before they have committed the actual crime. Precrime bases its work on the visions of three psychics or "precogs" whose prophecies of future events are never in error. When Anderton discovers that he has been identified as the future killer of a man he's never met, he is forced to become a fugitive from his own colleagues as he tries to uncover the mystery of the victim-to-be's identity. When he kidnaps Agatha (Samantha Morton), one of the precogs, he begins to formulate a theory about a possible frame-up from within his own department. Directed by Steven Spielberg, who hired a team of futurists to devise the film's numerous technologically advanced gadgets, Minority Report co-stars Colin Farrell, Max von Sydow, and Neal McDonough(n)

programme.title: The Legend of Tarzan
programme.desc: Years after leaving the jungle and settling down with his wife Jane (Margot Robbie) in London, Tarzan (Alexander Skarsgård) is forced to return to the Congo in order to act as a trade representative for England. However, he soon clashes with a greedy Belgian captain (Christoph Waltz) who has sinister plans for his old home. David Yates directed this adaptation of Edgar Rice Burroughs' classic tales. Samuel L. Jackson, Djimon Hounsou, John Hurt, and Jim Broadbent co-star(n)

programme.title: Central Intelligence
programme.desc: A mild-mannered accountant runs into an old high-school classmate, an overweight loser-turned-muscular CIA agent, and ends up helping him with a crucial mission involving the hacking of U.S. spy satellites(n)

programme.title: Ballers
programme.desc: Pilot. In the premiere of this comedy-drama about the complicated lives of current and former NFL players, Miami Dolphins legend Spencer Strasmore struggles to adjust to retirement while mentoring his younger friends, including a hot-headed wide receiver whose unruly behavior in a club could jeopardise his career(n)

programme.desc: Raise Up. Spencer clashes with Reggie when he tries to sign Vernon as a client, while Jason works on a contract extension with Dallas. Elsewhere, Charles begins to wonder if he retired too early; and Ricky fails to connect with a new teammate(n)

programme.title: Ballers

programme.title: Ballers
programme.desc: Machete Charge. Ricky tries to find common ground with Alonzo; Charles' marriage is put to the test; Vernon gets help from Spencer and Joe with a crisis(n)

programme.desc: Ends. Ricky flies off the handle; Spencer and Charles say good-bye to Roddney; Jason meets his mother's new beau(n)

programme.title: Ballers
programme.desc: Gaslighting. Spencer tries to save Vernon by confronting his past; Ricky tries to reconcile with Bella; Charles finds that his football skills come in handy(n)

programme.title: Ballers
programme.desc: Head-On. Joe feels slighted when his efforts at work go unnoticed; Spencer tries to make amends; Bella challenges Ricky to act like an adult; Vernon is nowhere to be found after discovering what Reggie's been up to(n)

programme.title: Ballers
programme.desc: Flamingos. In the series 1 finale, Spencer faces a tough decision when Joe has an idea for a new venture; Ricky is confronted by his dad; Charles gets another chance; and Jason and Spencer try to get through to Vernon once and for all(n)

programme.title: Ballers
programme.desc: Face of the Franchise. Spencer clashes with an old foe when he reluctantly agrees to be a guest on Jay Glazer's talk show, a mêlée that tarnishes his reputation and creates bad publicity for the company(n)

programme.title: Ballers
programme.desc: Enter the Temple. Spencer pursues a big client who's already represented by a powerful rival; Ricky mulls his next move; Tracy lobbies for a bigger role at work; Reggie feels undervalued by Vernon(n)

programme.title: Ballers
programme.desc: Elidee. Vernon's advised to keep mum about how he got injured; Spencer and Joe clash over the handling of a client as they fend off Andre's threats; Charles isn't sure he's ready for a new challenge; Ricky thinks about relocating(n)

programme.title: Ballers
programme.desc: World of Hurt. A search for Andre's weakness becomes a full-time job for Spencer and Joe; Vernon's anxiety gets the best of him; Jason's pursuit of a client is no easy task; Ricky tries to figure out where his dad is coming from(n)

programme.title: Ballers
programme.desc: Most Guys. Spencer counsels Travis, but is distracted by a possible health crisis and a sketchy financial history. Meanwhile, Reggie and Joe try to cheer up Vernon and Ricky advises Charles to take a stand(n)

programme.title: Ballers
programme.desc: Saturdaze. Travis' clash with a critic finds Spencer trying to play mediator; Charles becomes a reluctant bearer of bad news in his new role with the team; Joe has a one-on-one meeting with Andre; Ricky is shocked by his father's desire for a bigger role in his life(n)

programme.title: Ballers
programme.desc: Everybody Knows. Andre's surprise visit to the office sends Spencer scrambling to stay one step ahead of his rival. Meanwhile, Joe learns some unsavory secrets about his partner; Ricky tries to make up with his dad; and Charles schemes to keep a friend nearby(n)

programme.title: Ballers
programme.desc: Laying in the Weeds. Spencer's Draft Day party finds him trying to keep a lid on the firm's private affairs. Meanwhile, Charles and Ricky have a major disagreement; and Travis wonders how bright his future will be(n)

programme.title: Ballers
programme.desc: Million Bucks in a Bag. Spencer gets a surprising offer from Andre, Ricky mulls where to put down roots, Vernon works overtime to return to the field and Charles and Julie clash over his busy schedule(n)

programme.title: Ballers
programme.desc: Game Day. In the Season 2 finale, Spencer takes a final stab at regaining what he's lost; Ricky waits for a call that will determine his future; Vernon goes on a road trip; and Charles gets an offer from Siefert that could be more trouble than it's worth(n)

programme.title: HBO First Look: 'War for the Planet of the Apes'
programme.desc: A look at "War for the Planet of the Apes," a 2017 thriller about an ape army's struggle against homo sapiens. The film stars Andy Serkis, Woody Harrelson and Steve Zahn, and is directed by Matt Reeves(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Dragonstone. In the Season 7 premiere, Jon organizes the defence of the North; Cersei seeks to even the odds; and Daenerys comes home(n)

programme.title: Shaft
programme.desc: Dynamic Samuel L. Jackson stars as New York City cop John Shaft, who quits the force and decides to dispense his own brand of vigilante justice against a racist killer (Christian Bale) and a Dominican drug lord (Jeffrey Wright). Richard Roundtree, who played the original John Shaft in three '70s crime dramas, has a cameo as Jackson's uncle and namesake. Busta Rhymes, Vanessa Williams, Dan Hedaya(n)

programme.title: Rush Hour 3
programme.desc: In this slick, slam-bang sequel mismatched cops head to Paris to unravel a plot by Triad gangs to assassinate a Chinese diplomat(n)

programme.title: Crimson Peak
programme.desc: A mysterious stranger woos a young woman and brings her to his mansion atop a clay mountain. There, she learns that her new home holds many disturbing secrets as she fights for her sanity and her very life(n)

programme.title: Unbreakable
programme.desc: Supernatural thriller about a security guard who, having been the sole survivor of a high-fatality train crash, finds himself at the centre of a mysterious theory that explains his consistent physical good fortune. When news of his survival is made public, a man whose own body is excessively weak tracks him down in an attempt to explain his unique unbreakable nature(n)

programme.title: Cake
programme.desc: A wedding-wary writer takes over the reigns of her father's bridal magazine, where she meets two men who cause her to rethink her position on marriage(n)

programme.title: Serendipity
programme.desc: After the long-delayed Town and Country, director Peter Chelsom turns in his second 2001 effort with this love-at-first-sight romantic comedy that revolves around fate, destiny, and chance. Jonathan (John Cusack) and Sara (Kate Beckinsale) are two New Yorkers already in relationships when they meet one another, each reaching for the last pair of cashmere gloves at a department store. Over coffee, they strike up an intimate conversation, and Jonathan thinks they should see each other again. Unconvinced, Sara arranges an elaborate series of "fate" games; if they're meant to be together, she reasons, she and Jonathan will receive some sort of sign in the future. Flash forward several years, and the two are at opposite ends of the country -- Jonathan in New York and Sara in San Francisco, both engaged to be married. Still, neither can shake the memory of their chance encounter, and they both enlist their best friends (Molly Shannon and Jeremy Piven) to help them find their true love again. Serendipity had its Gala World Premiere at the 2001 Toronto Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen
programme.desc: Two years after saving the world with the Autobots, Sam Witwicky is heading off to college when an ancient Decepticon named The Fallen returns to Earth seeking revenge. Their home planet of Cybertron rendered uninhabitable, the Autobots begin working with the military to hunt down any remaining Decepticons. Meanwhile, Sam and Mikaela race to unlock the secret history of the Transformers on Earth to save the planet(n)

programme.title: The Conjuring 2
programme.desc: Paranormal investigators Ed and Lorraine Warren travel to England to work on an eerie case about an evil disturbance at a London council house(n)

programme.title: Indignation
programme.desc: A young Jewish atheist attends college in 1951 Ohio, where he clashes with the school's established social order and his overbearing parents' hopes for his future. At the same time, he falls for an attractive, complicated classmate named Olivia(n)

programme.title: Vice
programme.desc: A World in Disarray. An examination of the past, present and future of U.S. foreign policy and how post-Cold War alliances have shifted features conversations with diplomats, politicians and scholars, including Council on Foreign Relations president Richard Haass; former secretary of state Condoleezza Rice; former British prime minister Tony Blair; former UN ambassador Samantha Power; political scientist Francis Fukayama; and Sen. Chris Murphy (D-Conn.)(n)

programme.title: The Legend of Tarzan
programme.desc: Years after leaving the jungle and settling down with his wife Jane (Margot Robbie) in London, Tarzan (Alexander Skarsgård) is forced to return to the Congo in order to act as a trade representative for England. programme.title: Straight Outta Compton
programme.desc: Electrifying chronicle of the seminal rap group N.W.A. and their 'hood-to-riches success, tracing their story from the mean streets of mid-'80s Compton to their triumphant battles against censorship(n)

programme.title: Ballers
programme.desc: Seeds of Expansion. Series 3 begins with Spencer looking to score some high-profile clients to pay off his debts, but he hits a roadblock when Mr. Anderson wants to focus on the Las Vegas market by partnering with a casino magnate(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Stormborn. Daenerys has a surprise visitor; Jon faces a revolt; Tyrion draws up plans to conquer Westeros(n)

programme.title: The Other Side of the Door
programme.desc: An American family living in India are devastated when their young son is killed in an accident. The wife soon performs a ritual at a Hindu temple to speak to the dead, but her actions cause her family to be haunted by an otherworldly force(n)

programme.title: Loving
programme.desc: Biopic about Virginian interracial couple Richard and Mildred Loving, whose arrest in 1958 for violating the state's miscegenation laws eventually led to a landmark Supreme Court decision(n)

programme.title: The Defiant Ones
programme.desc: Part 3. Part 3 of 4. Jimmy co-founds Interscope Records and cuts a deal with Death Row Records to become the label's distributor. But hostility mounts across America at the violence in rap music. Jimmy, Snoop Dogg and Tupac Shakur become embroiled in a violent feud with East Coast rap rivals, including Sean "Puffy" Combs and his Bad Boy Records(n)

programme.title: The Defiant Ones
programme.desc: Part 4. Part 4 of 4. Dre produces Eminem's "The Slim Shady LP" that takes the rap music world by storm. Later, Dre and Jimmy create Beats Electronics and make a historic 2014 deal with Apple(n)

programme.desc: A man (Sam Rockwell) attempts to pull his life together by teaching his daughter's (Emma Roberts) high-school basketball team in this indie comedy by Grace Is Gone writer/director James C. Strouse. Rob Corddry co-stars in this Gigi/Plum Pictures production(n)

programme.title: Protocol
programme.desc: Sweet, unsophisticated Sunny is working as a cocktail waitress. She saves a visiting dignitary and as a reward she gets a top office job in Washington. She has to fight against a devious protocol officer but with her charms, she saves the day when she gets involved in an arms deal with an Arab country(n)

programme.title: Blast From the Past
programme.desc: A naive man experiences the real world for the first time after being raised in a bomb shelter since the Cuban Missile Crisis. While stocking up on supplies for his still-underground parents, he falls for a cynical '90s gal in this charming rom com(n)

programme.title: Broadcast News
programme.desc: William Hurt is the slow-thinking, good-looking anchorman competing alongside reporter Albert Brooks for the heart of sharp cookie Holly Hunter. An 80s classic - satire and love in a Washington news bureau, with a supporting cast that includes Joan Cusack and Jack Nicholson(n)

programme.title: Men in Black II
programme.desc: Action-packed sequel to the sci-fi comedy about a top secret government task force set up to deal with unruly extraterrestrials. An MIB agent turns to his former mentor to help him save the world from a rampaging, shape-shifting alien who has taken on the outward appearance of a sexy lingerie model(n)

programme.title: Crooklyn
programme.desc: Semi-autobiographical tale from Spike Lee based on his childhood growing up in 70s New York. Young Troy watches her parents fight over money, and gets a chance to see how the other half lives when she visits wealthy cousins in the country(n)

programme.title: Rat Race
programme.desc: A madcap chase ensues when a crooked hotelier offers two million dollars to the first person who can find it(n)

programme.title: Shakespeare in Love
programme.desc: Romantic comedy about a fictional relationship between William Shakespeare and a young woman who poses as a man in order to star in one of the writer's plays. Suffering from writer's block, Shakespeare is in need of a new muse. He soon finds inspiration in the form of a beautiful female aristocrat, but her daring determination to act in his play puts their already forbidden relationship on even more dangerous ground(n)

programme.title: Be Cool
programme.desc: Disenchanted with the movie industry, Chili tries the music industry and meets a widow of a music exec(n)

programme.title: Men in Black II
programme.desc: Action-packed sequel to the sci-fi comedy about a top secret government task force set up to deal with unruly extraterrestrials. An MIB agent turns to his former mentor to help him save the world from a rampaging, shape-shifting alien who has taken on the outward appearance of a sexy lingerie model(n)

programme.title: Crooklyn
programme.desc: Semi-autobiographical tale from Spike Lee based on his childhood growing up in 70s New York. Young Troy watches her parents fight over money, and gets a chance to see how the other half lives when she visits wealthy cousins in the country(n)

programme.title: Mike and Dave Need Wedding Dates
programme.desc: Two hard-partying ladies see a viral video in which unruly brothers plead for dates for their sister's wedding in Hawaii, and decide to pose as the angels they're looking for in order to score a free trip in this incredibly raunchy comedy(n)

programme.title: Beginner's Guide to Sex
programme.desc: An innocent virgin, Laci Cox is hired to teach a high school students sexual education(n)

programme.title: Earth Girls Are Easy
programme.desc: Colourful musical comedy about three aliens who crash-land in the swimming pool of a Los Angeles beautician and find that the Valley is a much stranger world than any extraterrestrial habitation. Having had a crash course in Earth culture from television and a transforming visit to the Curl Up and Dye' beauty parlour they venture out and discover that Earth holds many weird delights(n)

programme.title: Ernest Scared Stupid
programme.desc: Ernest (Jim Varney) gets into deep trouble when he decides to build a treehouse for the neighborhood kid and accidentally digs up an ugly, evil-tempered troll who hates all children and shows it by promptly turning the five kids helping Ernest into wooden sculptures. This is the fourth entry in the Ernest series and is filled with the goofy humor that has made the films popular with preadolescent kids(n)

programme.title: Necessary Roughness
programme.desc: After sacking their old team, Texas State University hire a coach to assemble a new football team. The motley crew he collects includes a retired high-school football star, a military fanatic, a physics teacher and, as place kicker, a dishy female. Overcoming all obstacles on and off the field, they attempt to win the championship(n)

programme.title: Be Kind Rewind
programme.desc: After a freak accident causes all the tapes in a video store to be erased, an employee and his pal decide to make their own no-budget re-creations of various movies. Jack Black and Mos Def star in this sweet and surreal fable from director Michel Gondry ("The Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind"). Danny Glover, Mia Farrow, Melonie Diaz, Sigourney Weaver(n)

programme.title: Fast Times at Ridgemont High
programme.desc: A study of adolescent obsession with sex, drugs, and rock and roll has a girl seeking romance advice from an upperclassman on how to get a boy to notice her; and a stoner feuding with a teacher(n)

programme.title: Keanu
programme.desc: Two straight-laced friends pose as drug dealers and try their best -- and sometimes fail -- to fit in with the thug circle in order to retrieve a stolen kitten(n)

programme.title: Grumpier Old Men
programme.desc: The testy oldsters prepare for their children's wedding while fighting to save their local bait shop from turning into an Italian restaurant(n)

programme.title: The Breakfast Club
programme.desc: Teen-angst comedy drama. Five total strangers - an athlete, a spoiled rich kid, a brainy nerd, an introverted loner and a rebellious punk - are brought together on a day-long detention where they break the rules, bare their souls and find they have more in common than just attending the same high school. One of the plethora of 80s teen films, John Hughes's bittersweet 'brat pack' comedy has many perceptive moments(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons Movie
programme.desc: Homer causes havoc when he pollutes Lake Springfield to dangerous levels. When the toxic town gets sealed under a giant glass dome, it looks like the end for the people of Springfield. Can the Simpson family save the day?(n)

programme.desc: The spy spoof series gets the big screen treatment with this action comedy(n)

Breslin is Nim, a feisty South Pacific islander who recruits an adventure novelist (Foster) to help rescue the girl's biologist dad (Gerard Butler), who is lost at sea. programme.title: Dr. Seuss' Horton Hears a Who!
programme.desc: (2008) Jimmy Hayward and Steve Martino's animated family film, based on Dr Seuss' book, stars Horton (voiced by Jim Carrey), a elephant. One day, wandering through the jungle, he hears a voice coming from a mote of dust. It turns out to be the tiny planet of the Whos, who are threatened with destruction. Horton agrees to help them and, catching them safely on a flower, seeks the help of the others in the jungle. But the Kangaroo, ruler of the jungle, believes, "If you can't see it, it's not there" and hires the vulture Vlad to eliminate the planet. Can Horton save the Whos? With Steve Carrell as the voice of the Mayor of Whoville, and Isla Fisher as a Who doctor, Mary Lou Larue(n)

programme.title: Hannah Montana/Miley Cyrus: Best of Both Worlds Concert
programme.desc: Fans of Miley Cyrus and her pop-star alter ego on her series Hannah Montana get the best of both worlds with this live concert film. Shot during her 54-city musical tour, this concert captures Cyrus performing both as herself and as Hannah(n)

programme.title: Dr. Dolittle 3
programme.desc: The apple doesn't fall far from the tree for teenage Maya Dolittle (Kyla Pratt), who's sent to a dude ranch for the summer and learns that she has inherited her father's gift of communicating with the animals. She uses her talent to help her stable of furry friends kick up a fight to keep the ranch from closing. John Amos fills in for Eddie Murphy as the quirky Dr. Dolittle in the third film of the series(n)

programme.title: August Rush
programme.desc: Wonderfully rewarding urban fairy tale about a 12-year-old prodigy (the marvelous Freddie Highmore) who heads to New York City to find and reunite with the musician parents who abandoned him as a baby. Keri Russell and Jonathan Rhys Meyers costar as the young lovebirds who made sweet music (and a child) before their romance was dramatically and untimely cut short. Directed by Kirsten Sheridan. Robin Williams is a gas as a modern-day Fagin trying to "help" the lad in his quest(n)

programme.title: Catch That Kid
programme.desc: Comedy and action blend in this entertaining caper, a family-friendly alternative to "Ocean's Eleven." A carefree 12-year-old (Kristen Stewart) plans a bank heist to finance an operation to repair her paralyzed father's spine. She puts her plan in motion with the help of two friends---a computer geek (Corbin Bleu) and a mechanical wiz (Max Thieriot). Jennifer Beals(n)

programme.title: Speed Racer
programme.desc: A young race-car driver discovers that the world of auto racing is fixed in this live-action adaptation of the seminal Japanese anime. With the help of his family, he competes in a cross-country rally in order to expose those responsible(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding
programme.desc: In Joel Zwick's Oscar-nominated comedy, based on Nia Vardalos's stage- play, Vardalos stars as Toula Portokalos, a Greek woman who's approaching a certain age, as her family are more than happy to remind her. But when she falls for Ian Miller (John Corbett), who's definitely not Greek, her family are in uproar. But Toula is determined to find happiness. Edited for language(n)

programme.title: The Golden Compass
programme.desc: Twelve-year-old orphan Lyra Belacqua lives in an Oxford college, where the academic and domestic staff do their best to push her enquiring mind down conventional educational routes and quell her tomboy tendencies; it's a losing battle. One day, having sneaked into a private meeting of the college's dons, Lyra learns of mysterious events taking place in the Arctic. Soon after, amid news of mysterious child abductors called the 'Gobblers', her best friend Roger vanishes. The fearless Lyra sets off, determined to rescue her playmate. But Lyra's is a parallel universe: one with VIctorian-style technology; where people's souls take the form of character-suggesting visible animals; witches and talking, armoured polar bears rule the cold lands of the north; and an organisation called The Magisterium aims to assert its authority over everyone. Lyra's journey will prove a dangerous one; one that uncovers the terrible truth that links the Gobblers and the Arctic phenomenon she heard about in the safety of Oxford. Also starring Eva Green, and the voices of Freddie Highmore and Ian McKellen. Sadly, it now looks as though the following two films in the series are fated not to be made. Even so, this stands as a stirring, thoughtful family adventure that's reasonably true to Pullman's masterpiece(n)

programme.title: The League of Extraordinary Gentlemen
programme.desc: Sean Connery stars in this all-action adventure as Allan Quatermain, called out of retirement in Kenya to help the government avert a world war being fermented by master criminal The Phantom. Quatermain gathers together a top team; Dorian Gray, Captain Nemo, Mina Harker and The Invisible Man are among those recruited, each with a spectacular skill. From Venice to the wastes of Mongolia, the team face perils and death in their desperate race against time. Stephen Norrington's fantasy, set in an alternative Victorian world, is frantic fun-filled action from start to finish, with the witty script matching awesome special effects(n)

programme.title: Snow Dogs
programme.desc: A Miami dentist inherits a team of frisky Alaska sled dogs from his deceased mother. A harmless comedy that's all bark and no bite(n)

programme.title: Serendipity
programme.desc: After the long-delayed Town and Country, director Peter Chelsom turns in his second 2001 effort with this love-at-first-sight romantic comedy that revolves around fate, destiny, and chance. Jonathan (John Cusack) and Sara (Kate Beckinsale) are two New Yorkers already in relationships when they meet one another, each reaching for the last pair of cashmere gloves at a department store. Over coffee, they strike up an intimate conversation, and Jonathan thinks they should see each other again. Unconvinced, Sara arranges an elaborate series of "fate" games; if they're meant to be together, she reasons, she and Jonathan will receive some sort of sign in the future. Flash forward several years, and the two are at opposite ends of the country -- Jonathan in New York and Sara in San Francisco, both engaged to be married. Still, neither can shake the memory of their chance encounter, and they both enlist their best friends (Molly Shannon and Jeremy Piven) to help them find their true love again. Serendipity had its Gala World Premiere at the 2001 Toronto Film Festival(n)

programme.desc: An American geologist flies to Antarctica to participate in a project at the United States Research Base, where he teams up with arctic guide Jerry Shepard and his best friend, Cooper. The scientist soon discovers that Shepard also has eight other valuable friends -- a pack of sled dogs he's worked with for years, who have rescued him from a number of tight spots(n)

He unleashes Doomsday who is set to destroy Metropolis, unless Superman and Batman can put aside their differences and defeat the new nemesis with the help of Wonder Woman(n)

programme.title: Bean
programme.desc: British comic Rowan Atkinson takes his bumbling TV persona Mr. Bean to the big screen in this genial comedy about a hopelessly hapless museum security guard(n)

programme.title: The Birth of a Nation
programme.desc: This searing historical drama recounts a real-life slave revolt that occurred in 1831 Virginia, led by a black preacher named Nat Turner. Turner is so appalled by the horrors he sees while sermonizing that he is moved to fight back(n)

programme.desc: When the first manned flight to Mars ends in mysterious circumstances, astronauts Jim McConnell and Woody Blake make a treacherous journey to the Red Planet to investigate(n)

programme.title: Mr. Deeds
programme.desc: Rags to riches comedy. Two-bit poet Longfellow Deeds inherits a fortune but finds telling friend from gold-digger difficult. Remake of the Frank Capra classic(n)

programme.title: Caught in the Crossfire
programme.desc: Chris Klein and Curtis "50 Cent" Jackson star in director Brian A. Miller's drama about two detectives who become the targets of both gangsters and crooked cops during an important investigation(n)

programme.title: Doomsday
programme.desc: The film revolves around a team that must work together in order to contain a deadly virus that might destroy the future of the human race(n)

programme.title: Midnight Special
programme.desc: In this cryptic sci-fi adventure from writer/director Jeff Nichols, Roy (Michael Shannon) rescues his son Alton (Jaeden Lieberher) from a religious cult in Texas, whose members worship the boy for his supernatural powers. Along with a state trooper (Joel Edgerton), the pair go on a cross-country journey as they are hunted by federal agents, who believe Alton might be a threat to national security. Kirsten Dunst, Adam Driver, and Sam Shepard co-star(n)

programme.title: End of Days
programme.desc: Fans of Arnold Schwarzenegger will be delighted as Arnie takes on his biggest fight yet...with the Devil himself! Satan, played by Gabriel Byrne, is in town and he has just one thing on his mind - to impregnate a woman with the Devil's spawn before the turn of the Millennium(n)

programme.title: Monday
programme.desc: No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: Rushmore
programme.desc: The critics were falling over themselves to praise this quirky drama that features a stunning performance from newcomer Jason Schwartzman as Max Fischer. Max is his school's brainiest kid by a long way, but he's also the most difficult - and when he falls for one of his teachers, it spells trouble. Bill Murray co-stars as a parent who provides initial solace and then competition for our lovelorn hero. Schwartzman is terrific, but it is Murray who walks off with the movie, along with a plate of carrots(n)

programme.title: Scream 2
programme.desc: While Scream (1996) was a funny, scary deconstruction of the slasher genre, its follow-up is just another horror sequel. The opening movie-theater sequence is even well-worn, being almost a shot-for-shot reconstruction of the beginning of He Knows You're Alone (1981), complete with a spooky trip to the restroom. The rest of the film follows tradition slavishly, and although the young cast is appealing and there are some nice individual moments, this film matches its predecessor neither in scares nor entertainment. Younger viewers -- who may not recognize every plot twist instantly -- should get a kick out of it anyway, but dedicated genre fans will be able to play connect-the-dots with the familiar storyline(n)

programme.title: The Huntsman: Winter's War
programme.desc: This spin-off of Snow White and the Huntsman acts as both prequel and sequel to the original film, detailing the adventures of Eric the Huntsman (Chris Hemsworth) as he gets caught up in the rivalry between wicked queens Ravenna (Charlize Theron) and Freya (Emily Blunt). During his quest, Eric is also endangered by his feelings for fellow warrior Sara (Jessica Chastain), since ice queen Freya has decreed that love is forbidden in her kingdom. Directed by Cedric Nicolas-Troyan(n)

programme.title: Steel
programme.desc: Action-packed adventure about a military scientist who takes to the streets as a hi-tech crusader when his work on a formidable new weapon is hijacked. When a version of his weapon - which neutralises enemies without killing them - starts appearing in the outside world, he dons a special suit and transforms himself into a cartoon-style superhero known as 'Steel'(n)

programme.title: Watchmen
programme.desc: A dystopian fantasy adventure based on an unusually faithful adaptation of the highly regarded graphic novel written by Alan Moore (the genre's High Priest), directed by Zach Snyder. It's 1985 and Richard Nixon continues his tenure in the White House, massively popular with the electorate following his crushing defeat of the Viet Cong. However, it seems that the American public have fallen out of love with their superheroes, one of whom, Dr Manhattan, was largely responsible for the winning the VIetnam War. Now, he and his fellow crime-fighters are regarded as reprehensible vigilantes and have been banned by law. But, when one of their number - the vile, ironically named Comedian - is murdered, the former heroes begin to re-emerge from the shadows to investigate. They discover that a terrifying plan is afoot..(n)

programme.title: Bulletproof
programme.desc: An undercover cop is assigned to escort a fugitive to Los Angeles, where his testimony will help put a drug lord behind bars(n)

programme.title: Catch Me if You Can
programme.desc: Teenage fraudster Frank Abagnale Jr takes on various identities in order to cash fake cheques worth over $2.5m. But his outlandish scheme soon catches the eye of the FBI. Crime(n)

programme.title: Lady in the Water
programme.desc: Downtrodden caretaker Cleveland Heep is drawn into a dangerous world of 'narfs' and 'scrunts' by Story, an ethereal sea nymph who appears in the residents' pool(n)

programme.title: The Sweetest Thing
programme.desc: Former South Park writer and Win Ben Stein's Money sidekick Nancy Pimental makes her feature screenwriting debut with this relationship comedy. Cameron Diaz stars as Christina Walters, a jaded, club-hopping single woman in Boston who has given up trying to find the perfect mate to focus on "Mr. Right Now." Her equally cynical friend, Courtney (Christina Applegate), a divorce attorney, shares much the same attitude. Christina's life changes forever one evening at a nightclub where she meets Peter Donahue (Thomas Jane), a man she finds adorable and just about perfect. Unfortunately, Peter disappears and all she knows about him is that his brother, Roger (Jason Bateman), is getting married soon and having a bachelor party nearby. When crashing the party doesn't pan out, Courtney suggests they road trip to the wedding and Christina agrees, leading to encounters with a series of obstacles, including some funky leftovers and an insane bank security guard. The Sweetest Thing co-stars Parker Posey and Selma Blair(n)

programme.title: Term Life
programme.desc: Based on the graphic novel by A.J. Lieberman and Nick Thornborrow, this Focus World production directed by Peter Billingsley stars Vince Vaughn as an unscrupulous criminal who learns that he's been targeted by the entire underworld, prompting him to take out a million-dollar insurance policy to benefit his estranged daughter (Hailee Steinfeld). With 21 days until the policy takes effect, he must survive long enough for her to receive the payout(n)

programme.title: The Bodyguard
programme.desc: Thrills and romance blend in this glossy drama, which is powered by a splendid soundtrack and the star wattage of Kevin Costner and Whitney Houston. Costner plays an ex-Secret Service agent who's hired to protect a pop songstress (Houston) from a crazed fan. The film features the hit song "I Will Always Love You," plus the Oscar-nominated tunes "I Have Nothing" and "Run to You." Gary Kemp(n)

programme.title: The Assassination of Jesse James by the Coward Robert Ford
programme.desc: Western drama about notorious train robber Jesse James, who welcomes a new gang member, unaware that Bob Ford is planning to kill him(n)

programme.title: The Children
programme.desc: A New Year's gathering in the British countryside turns into a terrifying battle for survival when the youngsters become infected with a virus that causes them to attack the adults in a fit of homicidal rage. Eva Birthistle, Stephen Campbell Moore(n)

programme.title: Screwed
programme.desc: Scott Alexander and Larry Karaszewski, the screenwriting team who penned Ed Wood, The People vs. Larry Flynt, and Man on the Moon, made their debut as directors with this broad comedy. Norm MacDonald stars as a chauffeur who decides to get revenge on his wealthy boss by kidnapping her dog. Produced under the titles Pittsburgh, Ballbusted, and Foolproof, Screwed also stars Danny De Vito, Dave Chappelle, Sherman Helmsley, Elaine Stritch, and Sarah Silverman(n)

programme.title: Sinister 2
programme.desc: In this chilling sequel, two young brothers must defend themselves against a malevolent spirit that feeds on the corruption of innocence, and that documents its exploits in home movies(n)

programme.title: Lara Croft: Tomb Raider
programme.desc: Action tale adapted from the popular video game in which the eponymous heroine races against time to find an ancient relic before it falls into the wrong hands. The buxom adventurer travels to some exotic locales, where she battles a variety of fantastical creatures with the knowledge that the fate of mankind rests in her hands(n)

programme.title: Resident Evil
programme.desc: Based on the popular video game of the same name, Alice and Rain are the leaders of a commando-team who must break into an underground genetics laboratory operated by a powerful corporation. There, a deadly virus has been unleashed, killing the lab's personnel and resurrecting them as the evil Un-Dead(n)

programme.title: Vice News Tonight
programme.desc: Episode 169. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: Hostage
programme.desc: A former hostage negotiator-turned-small-town cop finds himself unable to escape his past when a gang attempts to burgle the home of a local wealthy accountant, holding him and his two children captive(n)

programme.title: Solaris
programme.desc: Science fiction mystery following a psychiatrist who is sent to investigate strange events on the Solaris space station, orbiting the planet Prometheus. Following the death of the expedition's commander, a force seems to take over the minds of the astronauts as even the psychiatrist is forced to question what is reality and what is imagination(n)

programme.title: Bullet to the Head
programme.desc: After watching their respective partners die, a New Orleans hitman and a Washington D.C. detective form an alliance in order to bring down their common enemy(n)

programme.title: Heartburn
programme.desc: Jack Nicholson and Meryl Streep star as husband and wife journalists in the hothouse of Washington politics whose marriage slowly goes awry under the pressures of their careers and his philanderings in Mike Nichols' film from Nora Ephron's screenplay and based on the real-life experience of her marriage to Watergate journalist Carl Woodward(n)

programme.title: Robin Hood: Men in Tights
programme.desc: A veteran of the Crusades brings together a ragtag group to do battle against an evil king, and gets help from a surprising source inside the royal castle in this spoof of the Robin Hood legend(n)

programme.title: The Big Lebowski
programme.desc: The Coen brothers' flashy tale of mistaken identity puts lazy, dope-smoking '60s reject Jeff "Dude" Lebowski (Jeff Bridges) in the middle of the mob, erotic artists and a scheming millionaire's daughter after he is confused with another Lebowski, a very wealthy one whose wife is in trouble with some unsavory characters. John Goodman, Julianne Moore, Steve Buscemi(n)

programme.title: Thirteen
programme.desc: Prolific production designer and art director Catherine Hardwicke makes her directorial debut with the coming-of-age drama Thirteen. Los Angeles teenager and overachiever Tracy (Evan Rachel Wood) is an excellent student in her seventh grade class and gets along well with her mother, Melanie (Holly Hunter). She fears that she's not cool enough to be friends with Evie (Nikki Reed), the most popular girl in school. Fueled with genuine adolescent energy, Tracy follows Evie's lead into the harsh realities of sex, drugs, and hard-edged adventure. Consumed with temptations and conflicting desires, Tracy loses her good-girl identity, greatly affecting her relationship with her mom. Partly autobiographical, Thirteen was co-written by Hardwicke and actual 13-year-old Reed, who are close family friends. Originally intending to write a teen comedy, they ended up creating a hard-hitting drama exposing the contemporary teenage experience. Thirteen was nominated for the Grand Jury Prize at the 2003 Sundance Film Festival, with Catherine Hardwicke taking home the Director's Award(n)

programme.title: Legend
programme.desc: This fascinating thriller follows the rise and fall of Ronald and Reginald Kray, identical twin gangsters who built a criminal empire in London during the 1950s and '60s using gruesome, unhinged tactics and savvy business acumen(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.desc: Vaccines. Vaccines are discussed(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones

programme.title: The Nice Guys
programme.desc: A pair of detectives stumble upon a sprawling conspiracy while investigating the alleged suicide of a once-prominent female porn star(n)

programme.title: The Happening
programme.desc: M Night Shyamalan's end-of-the-world thriller begins in New York City with an outbreak of inexplicable suicides, which rapidly starts to take on plague proportions. As the wave of self-destruction spreads, people do their best to escape whatever it is that's causing it. Among them are Philadelphia science teacher Elliot Moore (Mark Wahlberg) and his wife Alma (Zooey Deschanel), along with Mark's friend Julian (John Leguizamo) and his daughter Jess (Ashlyn Sanchez). Their initial plans to flee to the state capital don't work out, so they take off to the countryside, where they think they'll be safe. But it's not long before they discover that they may have made a bad choice..(n)

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: A hugely successful businesswoman is convicted of insider trading and sentenced to prison. After being released, she tries to earn redemption and revamp her public image by helping a group of young girls in their quest to sell brownies(n)

programme.title: Thirteen
programme.desc: Prolific production designer and art director Catherine Hardwicke makes her directorial debut with the coming-of-age drama Thirteen. Los Angeles teenager and overachiever Tracy (Evan Rachel Wood) is an excellent student in her seventh grade class and gets along well with her mother, Melanie (Holly Hunter). She fears that she's not cool enough to be friends with Evie (Nikki Reed), the most popular girl in school. Fueled with genuine adolescent energy, Tracy follows Evie's lead into the harsh realities of sex, drugs, and hard-edged adventure. Consumed with temptations and conflicting desires, Tracy loses her good-girl identity, greatly affecting her relationship with her mom. Partly autobiographical, Thirteen was co-written by Hardwicke and actual 13-year-old Reed, who are close family friends. Originally intending to write a teen comedy, they ended up creating a hard-hitting drama exposing the contemporary teenage experience. Thirteen was nominated for the Grand Jury Prize at the 2003 Sundance Film Festival, with Catherine Hardwicke taking home the Director's Award(n)

programme.title: Legend
programme.desc: This fascinating thriller follows the rise and fall of Ronald and Reginald Kray, identical twin gangsters who built a criminal empire in London during the 1950s and '60s using gruesome, unhinged tactics and savvy business acumen(n)

programme.title: The Cell
programme.desc: In Tarsem Singh's psychological thriller, Jennifer Lopez plays a child psychiatrist who is part of a team that has developed a drug-induced method to literally get inside disturbed children's minds to help them. Then FBI agent Vince Vaughn asks for her help - serial killer Vincent D'Onofrio is in custody but in a coma and unless she can unlock the secrets of his mind, an imprisoned girl will be his next victim in hours. Using visual techniques ranging from sci-fi influences to Bosch, Singh's audacious film is a stunning, chilling tour-de-force(n)

programme.title: Introducing the Dwights
programme.desc: An already-unstable household becomes a virtual battle zone when the son of a risqué comedienne and a has-been singer finds mom meddling in his love life in director Cherie Nowlan's dysfunctional romantic comedy. Twenty-one-year-old Tim Dwight (Khan Chittenden) comes from a peculiar family; his mother, Jean (Brenda Blethyn), is a bawdy stage comic renowned for her scatological sense of humor and his father, John (Frankie J. Holden), is a faded country-music star who now works as a low-rent security guard. While dad is busy trying to revive his flat-lined career, mom spends most of her time doting on Tim and his developmentally disabled brother, Mark (Richard Wilson). Upon meeting the beautiful Jill (Emma Booth), Tim believes his may have finally found the woman of his dreams. Unfortunately in Jean's eyes there is only room for one woman in Tim's life, and that woman is his mother. As Tim's relationship with Jill grows increasingly serious, the stage is set for a battle royal between the woman who once gave him life and the prospective mother of his future children(n)

programme.title: The Limey
programme.desc: Terence Stamp is Dave Wilson, fresh out of jail and setting off to Los Angeles to seek retribution for the murder of his daughter. Chief suspect is record producer Terry Valentine who also dabbles in drug deals with partner and minder Avery and Wilson is ready to take them on. Oscar-winner Steven Soderbergh's FilmFour-funded film is, at a superficial level, about revenge but on a deeper level, it is about two men from different worlds who share one thing - their time has passed and fate has brought them together(n)

programme.title: The Color of Money
programme.desc: Pool hustler Fast Eddie Felson finds the young, promising pool player Vincent in a local bar and he sees in him a younger version of himself. To try and make it as in the old days, Eddie offers to teach Vincent how to be a hustler. After some hesitations Vincent accepts and Eddie takes him and Vincent's girlfriend Carmen on a tour through the country to work the pool halls(n)

programme.title: Le Divorce
programme.desc: Based on the 1997 National Book Award-nominated novel of the same name by Diane Johnson (co-writer of the script for Stanley Kubrick's The Shining), Le Divorce is a romantic comedy from director James Ivory. Revisiting the "Americans in France" theme that Ivory explored in 1998's A Soldier's Daughter Never Cries, the film stars Kate Hudson as Isabel Walker. When she receives word that her pregnant poetess sister Roxy (Naomi Watts) has been left by her philandering French husband, artist Charles-Henri de Persand (Melvil Poupaud), Isabel offers her help and moral support. As the depressive Roxy struggles with the separation proceedings -- which include the rights to ownership of a work of art that's a family heirloom -- Isabel takes a job with author Olivia Pace and has a fling with the bohemian Yves (Romain Duris). But things get complicated when the younger, more impudent sister decides instead to pursue Charles' uncle, the snooty, married diplomat Edgar (Thierry Lhermitte), and when a mysterious man (Matthew Modine) starts stalking Roxy. Eventually, the rest of the plucky Walker clan has to come to the aid of the siblings. Stockard Channing and Sam Waterston co-star(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.desc: Mr. Monk and the Actor. Season Five of Monk begins as San Francisco's most efficient--and most obsessive-compulsive--private detective Adrian Monk (Tony Shalhoub) finds himself the central character of an upcoming movie. Much to Monk's relief, he won't be forced to play himself: Instead, the role of Monk has gone to Hollywood superstar David Ruskin (Stanley Tucci). Unfortunately, Ruskin is one of those method actors who insists upon meticulous pre-film research, and soon he is relentlessly dogging Monk's trail during a murder investigation. At first, Monk doesn't seem to mind, and actually enjoys showing off for Ruskin's benefit--but things take a sinister turn when Ruskin so loses himself in the role of "Adrian Monk" that he tries to exact his own personal vengeance against a suspect in the long-ago murder of Monk's wife Trudy!(n)

programme.title: Dark Shadows
programme.desc: Transformed into a vampire and entombed for 200 years after betraying vengeful witch Angelique Bouchard (Eva Green), 18th century fishing magnate Barnabas Collins (Johnny Depp) returns to Collinwood Manor in 1972, only to find his once proud estate in ruins and his family plagued by macabre secrets. It was the year 1752 when Barnabas' parents came to America to expand their business empire. But after establishing the thriving New England fishing town of Collinsport, the family experienced a series of misfortunes when Barnabas fell for the gorgeous Josette DuPres (Bella Heathcoate) and cast aside beautiful witch Angelique, who cursed him with eternal life and buried him deep in the earth. Returning home to Collinwood Manor after being dug up by a construction crew in 1972, Barnabas learns that Angelique has nearly driven his family out of business, and turned the townspeople against them. Determined matriarch Elizabeth Collins Stoddard (Michelle Pfeiffer) employs live-in psychiatrist Dr. Julia Hoffman (Helena Bonham Carter) and enchanting governess Victoria Winters (Heathcoate) to try and help young David Collins (Gully McGrath) get over the mysterious death of his beloved mother, but as Barnabas gets acquainted with his distant ancestors -- including Elizabeth's black-sheep brother Roger (Jonny Lee Miller) and headstrong teenage daughter Carolyn Stoddard (Chloe Moretz) -- their suffering weighs heavily on his shoulders. Later, when Angelique learns that Barnabas has returned on a mission to restore his family to its former glory and fallen for the radiant Victoria (who is actually Josette reincarnate), she vows to make his suffering unimaginable if he should dare refuse her once again. Jackie Earle Haley, Bella Heathcote, and Gulliver McGrath co-star(n)

The brothers share some of their earliest memories of her, recall the final contact they had with her before her death in August 1997 and discuss their feelings in the aftermath of that event. Featuring contributions from Elton John, Rihanna and Diana's brother, Earl Spencer.(n)

However, in a bizarre twist to the story, Sheila has not yet started her 50-year sentence. First she must finish the 25 years she was given for the attempted murder of her husband. Sheila has remained silent about the killing for 14 years, so Piers tries to get her to finally open up, while also looking into why she wanted both of her victims out of the way. Last in the series.(n)

programme.desc: Modern reworking of Agatha Christie's classic murder mystery, starring Pauline Collins, Oliver Ford Davies, Kenneth Cranham and Susan Hampshire. A football chairman hosts a glitzy party to celebrate a new signing, but as the guests raise their glasses to toast a successful future, his wife suddenly drops dead. A pair of MI5 agents are called in to investigate, and it's not long before the finger of suspicion points at the victim's husband - until he too is murdered.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Dr Merrick is called out to a remote farmhouse, where she discovers three children have been left orphaned by the death of their father. Adamant that the family should stay together, Steve helps the eldest fight a custody battle, but a series of obstacles stands in their way. Meanwhile, Vernon opens a caravan park, but it is David who ends up having to entertain the not-so-happy campers.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Steve does his bit for the community by taking a group of delinquents on an outdoor adventure course on the moors, but one of the lads falls and breaks his ankle, while another is wanted for stealing from a shop. Rural police drama, starring James Carlton and Geoffrey Hughes.(n)

Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, Louis Zorich and Patrick McGoohan, who also directed.(n)

Drama, starring Jack Shepherd and Jimmy Yuill.(n)

programme.desc: Feature-length drama. While holidaying at the plush Bertram's Hotel in London, Miss Marple is presented with a fresh challenge to her deductive powers when the reading of a will leads to a double murder. Geraldine McEwan stars as the elderly spinster with a nose for a mystery, with guest appearances by Peter Davison, Mica Paris and Francesca Annis.(n)

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: When Grace Phillips is killed in an explosion in a munitions factory, Foyle is asked by one of her co-workers to investigate the death. Initially he concludes a tragic accident has occurred until another woman is found murdered and Foyle starts to believe the deaths are connected. Wartime drama, starring Michael Kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: A barmaid's murder leads Lewis (Kevin Whately) and Hathaway (Laurence Fox) to a respected professor, who admits he once had an affair with the woman. However, they discover the killing was copied straight from the pages of a popular fantasy novel written by an Oxford tutor, suggesting it may be the work of a crazed fan - or something even more sinister. Guest starring Art Malik, Tom Mison and James Fox, father of Laurence.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: An arson attack on a Turkish social club leaves 17 people dead and Brooks, Devlin and Chandler fearing the crime was racially motivated. They uncover a trail of false identities, but face opposition from a respected barrister when they need to remove a key piece of evidence from a suspect's leg. Meanwhile, Steel is forced to confront one of his oldest friends. Guest starring Charles Kay, with Bradley Walsh and Jamie Bamber.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: A respected gynaecologist is accused of sexually assaulting a patient during a routine examination, but Brooks, Devlin and Chandler struggle to find any firm evidence and the team becomes divided. Crown Prosecutor Alesha Phillips refuses to accept defeat and takes on formidable defence barrister Phyllis Gladstone. Crime drama, guest starring Derek Riddell and Lesley Manville, with Bradley Walsh, Jamie Bamber, Harriet Walter and Freema Agyeman.(n)

programme.title: Wire in the Blood
programme.desc: Part one of two. Psychologist Tony Hill investigates what appears to be the honour killing of a Kurdish woman. However, the site where the body was found yields remains of other victims and an even more gruesome motive for the crimes. New colleague Chris Collins seems reluctant to pull his weight when a middle-aged teacher of his acquaintance is added to a growing list of the dead. Robson Green and Cristian Solimeno star in the thriller based on the novels by Val McDermid.(n)

programme.title: Wire in the Blood
programme.desc: Part two of two. Chris Collins admits he concealed a relationship with the killer's latest victim and is therefore a potential target himself. As Tony delves into the sordid world of Bradfield's sadomasochism scene, he realises he must protect Alex from the full horror of the crimes, and when his temporary assistant goes missing he is left to battle it out with the elusive enemy alone. Drama, starring Robson Green, with Simone Lahbib and Cristian Solimeno.(n)

programme.title: Lewis

programme.title: May the Best House Win
programme.desc: Guy Porritt narrates the competition in which homeowners rate one another's properties. In Blackpool, retail manager Dale Hitchman, cabaret artiste Liam Halewood, pensioner Norma Baskerville and private tutor Sam Daniels score their fellow contestants' homes in categories including interior design, homeliness, comfort and overall viewing experience, with £1,000 awarded to the winner.(n)

programme.title: May the Best House Win
programme.desc: The property-comparing contest arrives in Merseyside, where dance school owner Vicky Harrison shows off her detached 1970s house. Singer Emma Sharkey reveals her 19th-century terrace where she lives with her dog, and retired PA Glenys Jameson gives a tour of her Italian-inspired home. Finally, opera singer Terry Robertson unveils an Edwardian dwelling, complete with a music room. Narrated by Guy Porritt.(n)

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Stan buys a home brew kit and begins making his own beer - but underestimates its strength and turns up for work in no fit state to drive a bus. Comedy, starring Reg Varney.(n)

programme.title: Man About the House
programme.desc: Robin's plans for a romantic dinner for two are ruined when the Ropers have an argument. Seventies comedy series, with Richard O'Sullivan.(n)

Rural police drama, starring Duncan Bell, Peter Benson and Geoffrey Hughes.(n)

African-set wildlife drama, starring Stephen Tompkinson, Deon Stewardson and Hayley Mills.(n)

programme.desc: A patient who set fire to his own shop (guest star Tony Slattery) attempts to avoid police questioning by leaping into an ambulance and driving off towards the pier - unaware Alun and a sick man are in the back of the vehicle. Meanwhile, Dr Makori fears for her relationship with Dr Fox when he tells her he has been offered a job in Biafra. Medical drama, with Andy Wear, Paul Fox and Kananu Kirimi.(n)

programme.title: Wild at Heart

programme.title: Man About the House

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a family glassware business collapses following the death of one of its partners, Barnaby investigates allegations of financial irregularities, love triangles and a string of murders. Lapsed Freemason Jones uses his inside knowledge to explore the ceremonial aspects of two killings, but it is Cully's production of Hamlet that gives Tom the key to the mystery. John Nettles, Jason Hughes, Jane Wymark and Laura Howard star.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: A tragic communication error between officers leaves gay police constable Nick Bentley caught in the crossfire of armed drug dealers, with no back-up. Brooks and Devlin follow a lead to a small-time dealer who claims to have seen a second policeman standing nearby, doing nothing while his partner bled to death. The story shocks the detectives and their boss Chandler as they investigate a homophobic religious group at the centre of the incident involving members of their own force. Crime drama, starring Bradley Walsh, Jamie Bamber and Harriet Walter.(n)

programme.title: The Street
programme.desc: Mark Benton stars as depressed postman Wayne, who sinks to his lowest ebb when a speed-dating night goes terribly wrong. Convinced he needs to make a fresh start, he begins stealing cash from the mail, and finds an ally in 15-year-old illiterate truant Damien, who agrees to help him on his rounds. However, it is not long before the neighbours start questioning their unlikely friendship. With Melanie Hill and Michael Taylor.(n)

programme.title: World Cup Rivalries

programme.title: The Classic Car Show
programme.desc: A James Bond special begins with a celebration of the Aston Martin DB5 as Quentin Willson examines how it came to be part of the most successful product-placement deals in history, and what it is really like to drive one. Alex Riley manages to find an affordable Bond car in the form of the Triumph Stag, which was driven by Sean Connery in Diamonds Are Forever, Bruno Senna gets behind the wheel of a 1951 Aston Martin DB3 and Jodie Kidd checks out a Lotus Esprit.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: An unusually busy night proves too much for the A&E staff, driving a stressed-out Robert to lose his cool as the ward descends into chaos. The death of an elderly patient left unsupervised in a corridor and a violent confrontation involving her son brings matters to a head - and to add to Robert's woes, an aggrieved Christine questions his motives in offering her the consultancy. Meanwhile, Cathy can't believe her ears when Mike makes a stunning announcement. Hospital drama, starring Martin Shaw, Niamh Cusack, David Harewood and Jane Slavin.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Christine's promotion to Consultant, and the arrival of an ambitious new trauma surgeon, seriously unsettles her relationship with department boss Robert Kingsford, while Stuart is stunned to learn he's not the father of Louise's baby.(n)

programme.desc: A woman asks Kavanagh to ensure justice is done on behalf of her husband, who died on the operating table in mysterious circumstances - despite the surgeon's claims that he was alive and well when she stitched him up. As if that were not a tough enough assignment, the redoubtable barrister also faces the task of convincing son Matt that failing his A levels is not the end of the world. John Thaw stars with his real-life wife Sheila Hancock, Josette Simon, Lisa Harrow and Tom Brodie.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Things may be about to change for Nick when a new inspector arrives and Kate receives a job offer. Elsewhere, Greengrass struggles with his finances. Rural drama, starring Nick Berry and Bill Maynard. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Hudson accompanies James on a shooting weekend and makes such an impression on the Newbury family that they offer him a position as their butler. Back at Eaton Place he writes to accept the job, but it appears he is needed much more than he realised in the Bellamy household.(n)

programme.title: Outside Edge
programme.desc: The day of the Cromer game dawns and the team are determined to beat Fatty Woollacott's side at all costs - but a mysterious incident in Dorking threatens to put a spanner in the works. Comedy drama, with Brenda Blethyn, Robert Daws, Timothy Spall and Josie Lawrence.(n)

programme.title: Outside Edge
programme.desc: As Brent Park looks ahead to a new season, Roger tries to make amends with Miriam before whipping the team into shape. Cricketing comedy drama, starring Brenda Blethyn.(n)
